1205.4605: This work proves an optimal time lower bound for a randomised distributed algorithm to find a close-to-optimal vertex cover on bipartite 2-coloured graphs of maximum degree Δ.
cond-mat0211354: The authors calculate the temperature of a ferromagnet-paramagnet transition in a double-exchange model for arbitrary Hund exchange coupling and electron bandwidth using the dynamical mean-field approximation.
cond-mat0008439: The suppression of superconductivity in ultranarrow wires is studied, and a resummation technique is used to calculate the transition temperature, showing good agreement with experimental data for the suppression of transition temperature due to disorder, but not for the additional suppression due to reduced dimensionality.
astro-ph9905126: The authors analyze X-ray spectra of the young star TW Hydrae, finding a two-component thermal plasma model with characteristic temperatures of 10-20 MK and an X-ray luminosity of 10^28 erg/s, suggesting substantial ionization of its circumstellar molecular disk.
1209.5739: This paper presents the foundations of summability calculus, a universal calculus that bridges various well-established results in number theory, summability theory, infinitesimal calculus, and the calculus of finite differences.
1103.3898: The authors propose a thermodynamic interpretation of the regularity condition in static, spherically symmetric solutions to Einstein's equations for self-gravitating radiation, by introducing a singularity entropy that is a functional of the properties of the singularity, and show that it satisfies the maximum-entropy principle, leading to a consistent thermodynamic description of the system.
1511.01019: Researchers construct a paradoxical decomposition of the real number line into four subsets, reassembling them via piecewise rigid functions into two copies of the line, demonstrating the existence of a finitely additive measure on the line is impossible.
cmp-lg9708007: This paper proposes a novel approach to quantify the degree of relationship between Chinese dialects using phonological data and probabilistic finite state automata, providing a tool to help quantify one of the important parameters in historical linguistics subgrouping.
astro-ph9809169: A new semi-analytic model of galaxy formation and evolution is presented, accounting for dust extinction and predicting the cosmic infrared background and star formation rates in high-redshift galaxies.
1305.4155: The authors investigate the dynamics of Yang-Mills theories with Higgs fields, focusing on the Gribov issue, and distinguish different regions in parameter space for the physical spectrum of the theory, including regions with confined and unconfined gauge bosons.
astro-ph0210188: A hydrostatic model photosphere successfully models the 3 micron ISO spectrum of the moderately varying M giant R Doradus, but an additional absorption component is needed at 2.6-2.8 microns.
hep-th0211265: Researchers demonstrate dynamical vacuum selection in one-dimensional field theories with flat directions, where a specific vacuum is dynamically selected due to the presence of a topologically stable kink or domain wall.
astro-ph9601134: The paper studies Mixed Dark Matter (MDM) models with a low-mass thermal boson instead of a neutrino, finding that they make an equally good fit to the observed linear power spectrum when the boson is not its own antiparticle.
hep-ph9507341: Researchers develop a fully covariant treatment of soft photon resummation in finite temperature QED, showing that the heat bath selects a preferred frame and produces correlations in the radiation pattern. They obtain a lorentz-invariant comparison of the radiation pattern in vacuum and in a heat bath in terms of certain scalar coefficient functions. The results show that large logarithms appear in unfamiliar places at finite temperature, and the covariance tensor is no longer diagonal.
physics0405041: An improved cross-correlation algorithm using vector average over both frequency and time domain is presented, achieving convergence hundreds of times faster than conventional methods for white noise measurement.
0909.2424: Researchers develop a method to obtain continuous time evolution from discrete nonlocal recursion laws using Schröder's functional techniques, enabling the construction of exact continuous iterations and approximations to continuous iterations of certain dynamical systems.
1305.0572: The paper investigates the radio-loud Narrow-Line Seyfert 1 galaxy PKS 1502+106, detected by Fermi-LAT, and discusses its characteristics, including its relativistic jet, high-energy emission, and blazar-like properties.
hep-ph9705423: The authors calculate the pion weak decay constant, two-photon decay width, and transition form factor within a QCD-based model, finding agreement with experimental data and reaching the Brodsky-LePage limit at high energies.
1009.3103: The paper discusses the Wheeler-Feynman electrodynamics, a theory of classical electromagnetism without fields, and its relation to the Maxwell-Lorentz electrodynamics. It presents a fixed-point procedure to find solutions to the Wheeler-Feynman equations on finite time intervals, and proves the existence and uniqueness of solutions to the Synge equations on the time half-line.
1208.3862: The paper proves a weak Bernstein-von Mises theorem for nonparametric Bayesian procedures, showing that the posterior distribution is asymptotically normal with mean equal to the efficient estimator and covariance equal to the Cramer-Rao bound, under certain conditions on the prior distribution.
astro-ph9608145: Researchers observe periodic oscillations in the optical and soft X-ray flux of high-accretion rate cataclysmic variables, correlating with mass-accretion rate and white dwarf spin period.
1702.01389: This paper compares Non-Orthogonal Multiple Access (NOMA) and Sparse Code Multiple Access (SCMA) techniques for 5G wireless networks, proposing resource allocation methods for both systems and evaluating their system sum-rate and complexity.
cond-mat0411057: Researchers study the interaction between a squid ring and an external quantum electromagnetic field, revealing strong coupling and energy exchange between the two systems, and demonstrating the potential for entanglement and quantum computing applications.
1610.06514: The paper proves a bound on the size of a k-system of curves on a surface, showing that it grows at most linearly in the number of punctures, improving previous bounds.
astro-ph0205316: The authors investigate the mass profile of the dark matter halo of the giant elliptical galaxy NGC 6166 in the cluster Abell 2199 using spectroscopic and photometric data. They derive the stellar mass density profile and the projected line-of-sight velocity dispersion profile, and use these to constrain simple spherically symmetric mass models. The results suggest that the galaxy's stellar mass alone cannot support the observed velocity dispersion profile, and that a dark matter halo is required. The best-fit two-component
1202.5303: Researchers investigate the electronic structure of antimony (110) surface, a non-(111) surface of a topologically non-trivial material, and find agreement with topological predictions in certain high-symmetry directions.
gr-qc0306010: This paper numerically studies the gyromagnetic factor of rotating and charged relativistic compact stars within general relativity, finding it to be linked with the strength of the gravitational field, but not dependent on the angular velocity.
0707.2607: The authors investigate the performance of the Delaunay Tessellation Field Estimator (DTFE) method in reconstructing the spatial density and velocity fields in the nearby universe, using the PSCz galaxy catalog, and demonstrate its ability to recover intricate anisotropic patterns and the multiscale character of both density and velocity fields.
1403.0012: This paper provides explicit expressions for the coverage probability of inter-cell interference coordination (ICIC) and intra-cell diversity (ICD) in cellular networks modeled by a homogeneous Poisson point process (PPP). The results show that ICD provides diversity gain while ICIC can only linearly affect the outage probability in the high-reliability regime, but ICIC is more effective in the high-spectral efficiency regime. The effective load model is proposed and validated to analyze the effect of ICIC in the non
0911.4160: Researchers experimentally measure the spreading of a fluorescently-tagged surfactant droplet on a thin glycerin layer, finding that the marangoni ridge initially forms behind the leading edge of the surfactant, but later catches up.
cond-mat0310749: This paper investigates the properties of a quasi-1D Bose gas at zero temperature using quantum Monte Carlo techniques, finding that the system is well described by a 1D model Hamiltonian with contact interactions and renormalized coupling constant for any value of the 3D scattering length.
1504.08355: The cosmological constant problem is resolved by a logotropic equation of state that unifies dark matter and dark energy, providing a natural explanation for the observed acceleration of the universe's expansion.
1602.07809: The paper introduces a notion of entropy for a group of isometries of a Gromov-hyperbolic space, which generalizes the concept of critical exponent. The authors prove that the entropy of a group is the supremum of the critical exponents of its Schottky subgroups, and that this result has several corollaries, including a generalization of a result of F. Paulin on the dimension of the limit set of a group.
cond-mat0407683: Researchers synthesize and characterize YbGaGe, a potential material for studying negative thermal expansion, and find normal thermal expansion behavior, contradicting previous reports of zero thermal expansion.
hep-ph0105065: The authors investigate the total cross section of proton-proton collisions at high energies, analyzing two ensembles of experimental data with different parametrizations, and use derivative analyticity relations to determine the ratio of real to imaginary part of the forward elastic scattering amplitude.
1010.6007: A local separation principle is stated for invariant systems on Lie groups, allowing for the stabilization of non-linear systems around a large class of trajectories, including permanent trajectories.
1309.3143: Researchers develop an analytical model for a single-atom electron source, describing the motion of an electron in a Coulomb-Stark potential, and derive closed expressions for the asymptotic transverse velocity distribution and virtual source size, predicting a lower electron temperature than expected due to the potential's bottleneck effect.
1507.04828: The doping-induced states in the small-doping limit of a Mott insulator exhibit a dispersion relation similar to that of the magnetic excitation, but shifted by the Fermi momentum.
cond-mat0009107: The authors propose an extension of the LDA+U method to include Coulomb interactions between oxygen p-electrons, improving agreement with experimental data for spectral and magnetic properties of strongly correlated transition metal oxides.
astro-ph9810313: The authors develop a semi-analytic approach to model the cosmic microwave background (CMB) anisotropies generated by topological defects, assuming the defects are statistically coherent and homogeneous. They derive the stress-energy tensor of the defects and solve the linearized Einstein equations to compute the CMB anisotropies, finding that the results are sensitive to the choices made for the free functions describing the defects.
1309.1012: This paper presents the first results from the analysis of the Kepler Asteroseismic Consortium's Working Group 12 (WG12) sample of 317 red giant stars, focusing on the variability of M giants.
0809.4915: Researchers develop data-driven background estimation methods for supersymmetry searches in ATLAS, achieving 4-8% statistical and 15% systematic uncertainty in one-lepton mode and 15% uncertainty in no-lepton mode.
astro-ph9806233: The authors investigate the gravothermal instability of spherical anisotropic stellar systems, finding that anisotropy causes systems to become unstable at lower central potential values, with no significant difference in spatial structure between isotropic and anisotropic systems for high anisotropy values.
1104.4231: Dwarf galaxies may have significantly contributed to the magnetisation of the intergalactic medium through relativistic particle injection and subsequent synchrotron radiation, potentially creating large-scale magnetic fields.
0711.2929: The Isotropic Diffusion Source Approximation (IDSA) is a new approach to neutrino transport in core-collapse supernovae, combining the advantages of diffusion and free-streaming limits, and efficiently handling the transition between them.
0908.0397: A flexible and robust hybrid scheme for hydrodynamics of molecular liquids is presented, combining atomistic, mesoscopic, and continuum models, allowing for a gradual change in molecular resolution and reducing calibration burdens.
1307.1733: The Nustar observatory's serendipitous survey detects 10 spectroscopically identified sources, revealing a diverse population of luminous active galactic nuclei (AGN) with high redshifts and faint optical counterparts.
1602.02139: A simple method for estimating the information fractal dimension of digital images is proposed, using data compression and freely available software, suitable for introductory fractal analysis in high school education.
1312.3724: Arianna navigation system provides visually impaired individuals with a tactile smartphone interface to navigate unfamiliar environments using colored floor paths and QR codes, offering real-time haptic feedback.
astro-ph9710258: Researchers analyze high-resolution spectra of quasars to study metal systems in the intergalactic medium, finding complex ionization structures and no significant evolution in ionization balance ratios over a wide redshift range.
astro-ph0002053: The spectral transition in black hole X-ray novae is understood as related to a critical mass accretion rate, where a standard disk reaches inward to the last stable orbit at high rates, producing a soft spectrum, and an adaf in the inner accretion region provides a hard spectrum at lower rates.
hep-ph9902380: The authors propose an alternative to the standard cold dark matter model to explain the observed spectrum of fluctuations in the universe, focusing on the possibility of decaying particles that can increase the horizon length at the equivalence time, thus increasing power at large scales.
0910.2396: The paper investigates the effect of stellar evolution on the orbital distribution of planets around evolved stars, finding that tidal interactions can capture close-in planets into the star's envelope, explaining the observed lack of close-in planets around evolved stars.
1303.1143: This paper investigates the dynamics of a Kerr-down conversion optomechanical system, where a degenerate optical parametric amplifier and a nonlinear Kerr medium are placed within a Fabry-Perot cavity. The system exhibits a competition between the gain and Kerr nonlinearities, leading to enhancement of the radiation pressure contribution to the normal modes of the cavity and normal mode splitting below the threshold.
0901.4969: The paper evaluates the classical and quantum capacities of a lossy bosonic Gaussian channel with correlated noise, showing that the global scenario is optimal in the presence of memory and allows to enhance the classical capacity over the memoryless channel.
1202.0336: Researchers construct higher derivative supersymmetric actions in superspace by identifying composite tensor and vector multiplets, enabling the generation of non-trivial supersymmetric actions from topological ones.
nucl-th0307021: Total fusion excitation functions of weakly bound projectiles are studied using full coupled channels calculations, revealing breakup enhancement at energies just around the barrier and negligible effect at higher energies.
1101.5941: A free-energy functional containing both symmetry-conserved and symmetry-broken parts of the direct pair correlation function is used to investigate the freezing of hard spheres into crystalline and amorphous structures, showing that the symmetry-broken term contributes significantly to the free-energy at the freezing point.
astro-ph0107474: A deep HI survey of the environment around the late-type spiral galaxy N3109 reveals a warp in its gas disk and a possible past interaction with the Antlia dwarf galaxy, which is located at the same radial velocity.
0704.2068: The spatial distribution of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) and very small grains (VSGs) in the giant H II region NGC 3603 is investigated, revealing a transition between ionized regions and photodissociation regions (PDRs) with PAHs being destroyed by high-energy photons.
1107.4525: Researchers analyze sonic crystals waveguides using the extended plane wave expansion method, revealing evanescent modes and level repulsion states that explain attenuation and symmetry transfer between bands.
astro-ph0001007: Surface photometry of NGC 4472 reveals a negative color gradient, indicating a metallicity gradient, and supports the hypothesis that giant elliptical galaxies form by stellar mergers.
cond-mat0311283: The breakdown of universality of conductance fluctuations in quantum dots occurs when the ergodic time exceeds the Ehrenfest time, requiring a more stringent condition than the dwell time.
cond-mat0212257: This paper is not a technical article, but rather an acknowledgement of funding support from the European Space Agency and Prodex.
1303.1373: The study investigates the influence of Terahertz (THz) radiation on DNA dynamics, specifically the melting transition and bubble formation, using the Peyrard-Bishop-Dauxois (PBD) model with thermal noise and solvation barrier.
cond-mat9709085: High-quality single crystals of YBCO grown in YSZ crucibles exhibit features in their microwave properties, inconsistent with a pure d-wave order parameter, and instead point to the occurrence of multi-component superconductivity.
1502.05165: The paper presents a new method called Periodic Von Neumann Basis (PVB) for simulating quantum dynamics, which is more efficient and accurate than the Multi-Configuration Time-Dependent Hartree (MCTDH) method for certain systems, particularly those with long-range dynamics.
0911.0389: Researchers develop a theory for continuous measurement of light scattered from ultracold quantum gases, enabling analysis of quantum back-action on atomic states and preparation of entangled states.
astro-ph9604041: The pairwise velocity dispersion of galaxies is highly sensitive to infall corrections, particularly in the presence of foreground clusters like Virgo, and its value is not robust across different surveys.
1406.6082: A new model explains the spiral structure and rotational velocity patterns of spiral galaxies using the gravitomagnetic field resulting from the post-Newtonian approximation of Einstein's gravity equations, without requiring dark matter.
1504.00467: The author derives a method to predict the Vainshtein screening mechanism's appearance in massive gravity theories, based on the Vainshtein conditions, and analyzes the effective mass for each mode, revealing different behaviors depending on parameter combinations.
hep-th9506021: The authors study the dynamics of vortices in the Abelian Higgs model, focusing on the excitation of vortices by the longitudinal component of the vector field. They use the polynomial approximation to obtain an analytic description of the excited vortex, including the profile and frequency of the excitation and the back-reaction of the excitation on the vortex. The results show that the excited vortex contains a radiative component formed of the vector field, which is a consequence of the non-linearity of
0705.1946: Researchers study Josephson current through d/af/d tunnel junctions, finding 110-oriented interfaces exhibit 0- or π-junction behavior depending on temperature and interlayer thickness, with potential applications in superconducting spintronics.
astro-ph0103219: We derive a preliminary brown dwarf companion frequency using field l and t dwarfs discovered as wide companions to known stars, indicating that brown dwarfs are not unusually rare as wide systems, but rare at close separations.
hep-ph9406422: The paper calculates the activation rate for thermally activated reactions in the Gross-Neveu model, a field theory with a metastable false vacuum state, and compares it to various approximation schemes.
cond-mat0208546: We studied the scaling behavior of domain walls in two-dimensional spin glasses, finding that the stiffness exponent is independent of boundary conditions and domain wall introduction methods for Gaussian distributions, with a final value of 1.
1305.5573: The authors prove the existence of a smooth solution to the inhomogeneous Allen-Cahn equation with a single transition close to a noncompact curve, under certain conditions on the potential and the curve.
1310.5994: A Monte Carlo event generator for Drell-Yan processes at the LHC is developed to provide precise theoretical predictions, including electroweak corrections and QCD effects, for precision physics studies.
1305.5832: Researchers develop a superconducting nanowire detector design that achieves maximum absorption at fill-factors less than 100%, compatible with optimized 180-degree bends, enabling efficient single photon detection.
1612.05594: This paper presents an importance sampling-based approximate optimal planning and control algorithm for nonlinear systems, which integrates model reference adaptive search and approximate optimal control to find the optimal weight vector for an approximate optimal feedback policy.
1005.5019: The phase diagram of model tetrahedral patchy particles is studied, revealing that the diamond crystal is only thermodynamically stable when the range of the potential is below a critical value, and its stability is driven by higher entropy at finite temperatures.
nucl-ex0308028: The NA49 experiment measures a suppressed yield of the Σ*(1520) resonance in Pb+Pb collisions at 17 GeV, contradicting thermal model predictions, and suggests a possible medium effect on the resonance itself.
1507.01983: 313p/Gibbs is an active asteroid ejecting dust near perihelion, suggesting intermittent sublimation of near-surface ice, with a nucleus radius of 0.6-0.8 km and a mass loss rate of 1 kg/s.
1406.3743: The authors investigate the effect of magnetic disorder on the electronic transport properties of graphene in a strong electric field regime, finding that the current and pair creation rate exhibit different behaviors in the paramagnetic and antiferromagnetic cases, with the latter showing a transition towards a subdiffusive regime and a suppressed pair creation rate.
astro-ph0410579: A semi-analytic chemical evolution model is used to study the formation history of the Milky Way and Andromeda galaxies, highlighting differences in their chemical properties and suggesting distinct galaxy formation scenarios.
1009.5399: A 1.6-year magnetic activity cycle is discovered in the F8V star HD 17051, with implications for stellar dynamo modeling and the understanding of short magnetic cycles in solar-type stars.
0705.4201: Researchers prove that pure braid groups of closed surfaces are almost-direct products of residually torsion-free nilpotent groups, implying they are residually torsion-free nilpotent and bi-orderable.
0809.0761: The paper discusses the resummation approach in the global versions of the one-loop Analytic Perturbation Theory (APT) and Fractional APT (FAPT) in Quantum Chromodynamics (QCD), achieving an accuracy of 1% with only four-loop calculations and four coefficients.
1001.4215: The paper explores the breakdown of the perturbative vacuum in asymptotically free gauge theory and the emergence of a laminated topological charge structure, interpreted as a tachyonic crystal, in both 2D and 4D gauge theories.
1501.05652: The authors model the complex light curve of J1407, a young K5 star, and conclude that it is caused by a highly structured ring system surrounding an unseen secondary companion, supporting previous conclusions.
cond-mat9902217: Researchers develop an analytic model for the ballistic adsorption of polydisperse mixtures of spherical particles, solved using a mean-field approximation, and validate it with numerical simulations and Monte Carlo simulations.
0812.1241: This paper disproves Stlund's conjecture that every immersed planar curve is simplifiable by showing a counterexample, a curve that cannot be simplified using only Reidemeister moves 1 and 3.
astro-ph9812194: This paper investigates the infrared emission from passive T Tauri disks, exploring how the spectrum changes with disk inclination and comparing model predictions with observations of the T Tauri star GM Aur.
1506.02703: This paper establishes quasi-concavity results for the multicast relay channel, enabling efficient optimization of signaling and relay position to maximize the multicast rate.
1006.3024: Dark solitons in a double well potential exhibit stable and unstable Josephson tunneling, with the stability determined by the Floquet multipliers of the solutions.
1202.3166: Researchers experimentally study quantum resonances in the atom-optics kicked rotor system, observing intrinsic quantum mechanics phenomena and demonstrating a deeper understanding of quantum dynamics.
1612.04284: A novel cryogenic distillation column is designed to remove krypton from liquid xenon to the ppq level, achieving a reduction factor of more than 10^13.
1608.03598: This work investigates the properties of periodically modulated neutron matter using large-scale simulations and qualitative insights, providing detailed benchmarks for other ab initio calculations and energy density functional approaches.
1511.08782: Researchers explore the efficiency of holographic heat engines in Einstein-Maxwell gravity with a Gauss-Bonnet sector, finding that the efficiency increases with the Gauss-Bonnet coefficient in certain schemes, potentially violating the second law of thermodynamics.
cond-mat0510665: Theoretical study of tunneling conductance and density of states in normal metal/diffusive ferromagnet/superconductor junctions reveals strong influence of resonant proximity effect on conductance and density of states.
1512.08642: This work studies the formation of warm plasma sheaths in environments with dust particles, focusing on the lunar plasma sheath as an example, and finds that dust particles affect the sheath dynamics by altering the plasma potential.
physics0410094: The authors study the nonlinear propagation of dust-ion acoustic waves in a dusty plasma, employing a Lagrangean formalism to investigate modulational stability and localized envelope structures.
1211.3618: The presence of a cosmological constant damps the mass accretion rate onto a black hole, with a stronger effect for negative values, and its impact becomes significant when the dark energy fraction exceeds the material fraction by at least three orders of magnitude.
hep-ph9911388: The article proposes a new physics explanation for the electroweak precision data anomaly, introducing higher-dimensional operators that modify the SM couplings, and constrains these operators using various experimental data, including the LEP/SLD Z-pole measurements and future collider data.
0902.1725: This study investigates the discrepancy in central velocity dispersions between luminous infrared galaxies (LIRGs) and ultra-luminous infrared galaxies (ULIRGs) and massive elliptical galaxies, suggesting the presence of young populations in LIRGs.
astro-ph0311632: The presence of dust in high-redshift galaxies affects their morphology and colors, leading to a systematic underestimate of their dust content and total infrared luminosity.
cond-mat9802210: Researchers develop a method to obtain maximally localized Wannier functions from Bloch orbitals, enabling the decomposition of electronic properties into atomic contributions, and apply it to study the dielectric properties of BaTiO3.
gr-qc0512003: A linear combination of the nodes of LAGEOS, LAGEOS II, AJISAI, and JASON-1 satellites can measure the Lense-Thirring effect with a total root-sum-square uncertainty of 4-5% over at least 3 years.
1502.07489: We present new HST/COS NUV observations of exoplanet WASP-12b, confirming reproducible excess NUV absorption during transit, an asymmetric transit with post-conjunction fluxes larger than pre-conjunction values, and rapid variations, but no strong evidence for an early ingress.
1310.5669: The authors determine the exact value of Stechkin's constant, a bound on the largest absolute value of irreducible Gauss sums, using a combination of previously known bounds and new bounds.
0908.0303: The authors study the electronic structure of iron pnictide superconductors using the Korringa-Kohn-Rostoker coherent-potential approximation method, and find that a small amount of excess Fe disorders the Fe-derived bands, while Se deficiency affects the Se-derived bands, and that the coherent-potential approximation is more reliable than other methods for describing substitutional disorder.
1306.1670: The paper studies the pair production of charged and neutral Higgs bosons in the neutrinophilic two-Higgs-doublet model at the future electron-positron collider, focusing on the clean environment and unique search scenarios.
1103.2573: This paper optimizes design coefficients for a full-rate full-diversity space-time block code to achieve non-vanishing determinants and maximum coding gain in 2x2 MIMO systems.
physics9911038: Researchers applied the Self-Organizing Clustering (SPC) algorithm to yeast gene expression data, identifying 11 clusters with highly correlated temporal variation, including three groups corresponding to well-known cell cycle phases.
1409.1814: Researchers develop a framework to identify quantum coherence in systems using interference patterns, enabling the detection of coherence properties beyond the intuitive expectation of increased interference contrast with coherence.
astro-ph0204439: Researchers challenge spherical models of blazar emission, proposing a disk-like geometry based on relativistic jet dynamics, which better explains spectral breaks and pair opacity.
cond-mat9702111: The authors derive a resolvent cluster expansion for a random Schrödinger operator with a large field versus small field condition, assuming the random potential satisfies large deviation estimates. They apply this result to a 2D Anderson model with an infra-red cut-off, showing that the model is asymptotic to its perturbative expansion and generates a small fraction of the expected imaginary part.
1008.1791: The authors investigate the detectability of redshifted rest-frame UV line emission from the intergalactic medium (IGM) at high redshifts, predicting that several emission lines will become detectable in the near future with upcoming optical instruments.
astro-ph0411653: The authors develop a comprehensive model of the physical, chemical, and dynamical structure of the circumstellar matter orbiting the Herbig Ae star AB Aur, using a combination of observations and theoretical modeling.
1212.6162: A new efficient method is proposed for determining the surface charge density of a conducting ball in an inhomogeneous electric field, yielding analytical solutions for charge density and force acting on the ball.
1107.5161: The paper proves a new class of linearization identities among hypergeometric functions using the correspondence between AdS and Minkowski theories, and applies this result to the expansion theorems for second-kind Gegenbauer functions and the Källén-Lehmann expansion of the product of two free-field two-point functions in AdS.
cond-mat0210454: Electron paramagnetic resonance (EPR) studies reveal distinct differences in electron and hole-doped manganites, providing insights into their electronic structures and charge transport mechanisms.
1202.5257: The paper proposes a new approach to thermodynamics based on the concept of "soft sets" and "piles" to address the Gibbs paradox and the limitations of the Boltzmann distribution.
1312.6960: This study optimizes the weights of energy terms in the Rosetta protein structure prediction tool to improve the quality of predicted structures and increase prediction efficiency.
0808.3098: This paper proves the global well-posedness of the generalized derivative nonlinear Schrödinger equation in modulation spaces with small initial data.
1012.5748: Thermal nucleation of antikaon condensed matter in neutron stars is investigated, with shear viscosity found to significantly impact the nucleation rate and time.
0804.0218: The authors study the UV absorption lines in the Seyfert 1 galaxy NGC 4395, with a low-luminosity black hole, to investigate the nature of the broad line region and the absorber properties.
1105.5025: New Chandra data reveals large-scale structures in the Perseus cluster, including outer rising bubbles and a cold front, suggesting a merger with smaller galaxies or groups.
1610.07117: A novel triangle singularity mechanism explains the peak around 1420 MeV in the BESIII data for the e+e- → K+K-π0 reaction, which has resisted theoretical interpretation so far.
1209.5594: Researchers propose a magnon transistor that can be controlled by electric or magnetic fields, enabling low-power computing and potentially replacing traditional electronics.
1608.05049: Researchers develop an approximate analysis of a driven-dissipative system, linearizing the dynamics and describing the fluctuations using a Gaussian propagator, with the approach being accurate until the nth moments become of order 1/n.
1203.4076: General Relativity is a simplified theory of gravitation, neglecting the spin structure of matter and assuming a Riemannian metric, whereas a more general formalism, considering Finsler metrics, is required to describe the gravitational behavior of spinning matter.
0904.4272: A technique of quotienting is used to study a class of mathematical objects by reducing the problem to studying the "basic" objects in the class. The paper investigates quotients of incidence geometries and pregeometries, and provides conditions for a quotient to be a geometry, including the (flagslift) condition, which states that every flag in the quotient arises as the projection of a flag in the original geometry.
astro-ph9804030: A sample of 13 bright southern hemisphere Be stars was observed at radio wavelengths, detecting 8 Be stars, including variable sources, and confirming a turnover in the spectral energy distribution between far-IR and radio wavelengths.
nucl-th0605007: A phenomenological, strongly attractive Woods-Saxon squared nuclear potential explains the elastic scattering of the 12C+12C system from 32.0 to 70.7 MeV with both optical and coupled-channels models.
1508.04797: The authors propose a simple picture of the plunge process in binary black hole mergers, where the plunge is determined by the conditions of the binary associated with the "light ring", and test this picture using a particle perturbation approximation and a Fourier domain Green function.
1307.6026: The authors propose a model explaining the complex x-ray pulse profiles of the accreting neutron star Her X-1, attributing the changes to the free precession of the neutron star with a complex non-dipolar magnetic field structure.
1301.4697: Numerical study of dimer adsorption on homogeneous flat surfaces reveals orientationally ordered clusters with exponential size distribution, primarily dependent on particle density, not interaction character.
1610.04546: Developers of scientific software should follow 10 simple rules to increase robustness, including providing a README, versioning releases, reusing software responsibly, using a build utility and package manager, and eliminating hard-coded paths.
0705.1611: The authors study the quantum phase transitions in the one-dimensional asymmetric Hubbard model using the bosonization approach, obtaining critical conditions for phase separation and analytical expressions for correlation functions.
1409.2660: The paper discusses the dispersion interaction between two-dimensional (2D) systems, including van der Waals interactions and Casimir interactions, and derives expressions for the interaction energy in various geometries.
1603.00453: The authors study a supersymmetric quantum mechanics model with quenched disorder, motivated by string theory, and analyze its low-temperature thermodynamics, finding a gapless phase with linear specific heat, reminiscent of near-extremal black holes.
hep-lat9509050: Researchers study a two-flavor Nambu-Jona-Lasinio model with a coupled chiral symmetry and deconfinement phase transition, revealing a larger class of critical behaviors in finite-temperature QCD.
1404.3260: The authors describe the centrality dependence of the J/ψ-to-Drell-Yan ratio in nuclear collisions, indicating a significant role of nuclear modification of parton densities, and predict the ratio in Au+Au collisions at the FAIR energy domain.
1110.2803: An asteroseismic analysis of the hot DBV WD J1929+4447 suggests it is more likely a blue edge DBV with a pulsation spectrum reminiscent of EC 20058-5234, contradicting its spectroscopic temperature.
1207.6350: The authors examine the McVittie solution with a negative cosmological constant, finding a global structure dominated by a collapse to a big crunch, similar to the pure Robertson-Walker case.
quant-ph0209079: Researchers study the dynamics of a spin-1/2 subsystem coupled to a low-temperature bath of interacting spin-1/2 modes, finding that strong intra-environmental interactions suppress decoherence by making the central spin evolve with its unperturbed and uncoupled hamiltonian.
1212.3472: This paper studies the properties of Wilson loops in a novel class of solutions that generalize the Klebanov-Strassler and baryonic branch solutions, which move the QFT to the mesonic branch by adding sources. The authors compute the Wilson loop for various backgrounds and find that the potential energy of the quark-antiquark pair exhibits a phase transition, which is interpreted as a boiling van-der-Waals gas. They also find that the phase transition can be tuned by varying
1001.4036: Galex observations of Comet 9P/Tempel 1 after the Deep Impact event provide a unique measurement of CS parent molecules excavated by the impact, with results consistent with quiescent outgassing and uniform mixing of volatiles with water ice.
0901.4801: The broad modification of the away-side peak in both Cu+Cu and Au+Au central collisions indicates interaction of heavy quarks with the dense medium.
0901.1235: The paper investigates the origin of TeV energy radiation from the blazar 1ES 0806+524 via inverse Compton scattering of disk thermal photons against centrifugally accelerated ultra-high energy electrons.
1611.06194: The paper proposes Expert Gate, a lifelong learning system that can sequentially deal with new tasks without storing all previous data, by learning a gating mechanism that selects the most related prior task to aid learning of the new task.
1110.5158: Researchers propose a modified Wheeler-DeWitt metric to describe the semi-classical regime of Causal Dynamical Triangulation (CDT) in 2+1 dimensions, obtaining qualitative agreement with experiments and strengthening the connection between CDT and Hoava-Lifshitz gravity.
1109.2852: Researchers develop an efficient protocol to generate small amorphous silica systems using classical molecular dynamics and Car-Parrinello molecular dynamics, achieving good agreement with experimental data and ab initio simulations.
1203.6185: Numerical relativity study on the effect of a third massive black hole on the dynamics of a binary black hole system, showing that the gravitational potential of the third black hole causes time delay, amplitude decrease, and higher-order mode excitation in the gravitational waveform.
cond-mat0211556: A dipole-induced-dipole (DID) model is proposed to study the dielectric effects on structure formation in electrorheological (ER) fluids, correcting the point-dipole (PD) results with multipole effects partially.
0708.1518: The authors study the structure of galaxy clusters using hydrodynamical simulations and compare the results to observations, finding that cluster structure is a powerful probe of cosmology and gas physics, and that the simulations reproduce the observed cluster morphologies remarkably well, but with some discrepancies that suggest the need for additional cooling in high-mass clusters and a reduction in the peakiness of low-mass cool cores.
hep-ph9901312: The effective potential at zero temperature is a tool to study spontaneous symmetry breaking in quantum field theories, and its calculation involves the use of the Legendre transform of the effective action. The one-loop effective potential for a real scalar field is given by an integral over the loop momentum, which can be computed using dimensional regularization or a cut-off regularization. The result is an ultraviolet-divergent expression that needs to be renormalized. The renormalization scheme used can affect the final result, and the
1407.2015: The authors use Gröbner bases to study equivariant signed polyomino tilings of the hexagonal lattice, providing a criterion for the existence of such tilings and explicit tilings predicted by theorems.
1511.06118: Researchers investigate the multifractal nature of collective fluctuations in magnetisation bursts (barkhausen noise signals) originating from domain walls motion and pinning in the random-field Ising model on the hysteresis loop, revealing a complex signal with fractal components and temporal correlations.
astro-ph0612188: This paper discusses the diversity of astrophysical black holes, from stellar-mass to supermassive, and their interactions with their surroundings, exploring their formation, evolution, and correlations among different types of black holes.
1602.06531: This work establishes sample complexity error bounds for multi-task and lifelong kernel learning, showing that learning multiple tasks jointly can "spread out" the overhead associated with learning a kernel, and as the number of observed tasks grows, the complexity converges to that of learning when a good kernel was known in advance.
1204.5011: Researchers develop a new method, the "Teneva game," to find upper bounds for the minimum number of colors needed to color a knot with a non-trivial coloring, improving previous results.
1604.03772: Black hole entropy production is studied in time-dependent scenarios, revealing three generic lessons: extensive entropy evolution, quasinormal decay, and saturation of area theorems, providing valuable information about the microscopic structure of quantum gravity.
1105.5859: The paper analyzes the distribution of neutron resonance widths, finding that the mean value can be much less than the registration threshold, leading to unknown systematical errors in published estimates of neutron resonance density.
1611.07558: This paper introduces a time-reversed Markov jump linear system (TRMJLS) and establishes a duality between its optimal control and filtering problems, extending the classic duality between filtering and control for standard Markov jump linear systems.
math0411201: A janitor in a museum with tricky electric connections must light up all rooms by pressing buttons that toggle lights on/off in the same room and neighboring rooms. A solution is found using linear algebra and graph theory, showing that all lamps can be lit under certain conditions.
1210.4065: Researchers study picene films doped with potassium, observing non-equilibrium behavior due to concentration gradients, and propose a relaxation mechanism using density functional theory and dynamical mean-field theory.
1603.04113: This study develops an iterative diagonalization scheme for the transcorrelated method using a plane-wave basis set, reducing computational requirement and enabling the explicit treatment of core states, which improves the position of deep valence states without affecting the upper energy region.
1010.5438: The authors investigate the effects of gravity generated by colliding objects in the BSW process, finding that the center of mass energy of colliding shells has an upper limit in the observable domain due to the gravity of the outer shell.
astro-ph9903455: The authors report upper limits for eight X-ray selected BL Lac objects and the object "Bl Lacertae" observed in 1997/1998 with the HEGRA CT system, ranging from 15% to 65% of the Crab flux.
0707.0586: Researchers investigate the applicability of the Pfaffian model to the real Coulomb solution in the fractional quantum Hall effect, finding a substantial breakdown of particle-hole symmetry and a non-monotonic energy splitting of the Pfaffian quasihole states.
1110.4015: The journal citation network is a dense, small-world, and robust network with high reciprocity and positive assortativity by degree, indicating a community structure with tightly interconnected sets of journals representing entire disciplines or fields.
1511.04881: The paper investigates the properties of motion in the planar circular restricted three-body problem, classifying orbits into bounded, escaping, and collisional types, and examining the basins of escape/collision and their correlation with escape/collision times.
1107.4880: The hadronic scale is reevaluated using non-perturbative evolution, showing agreement with perturbative QCD for reasonable parameters, and providing an explanation for the consistent evolution near the Landau pole.
0910.4549: Researchers propose an entanglement beam splitter using a singly charged quantum dot strongly coupled to a double-sided microcavity, achieving high-fidelity entanglement with 100% efficiency.
astro-ph0510310: Researchers simulate pulsar magnetospheres using resistive force-free electrodynamics and ideal relativistic MHD, finding that magnetic field lines remain closed beyond the light cylinder, contradicting steady-state solutions of the pulsar equation.
1701.00917: A new cloud model for exoplanets and brown dwarfs is developed, incorporating condensation and coalescence microphysics, and tested against terrestrial water clouds and jovian ammonia clouds observations.
cond-mat0507164: Researchers study the dynamics of infection spreading on a small-world network, finding that collective oscillations occur at finite non-local connection probability, and that timescales also play a crucial role in this transition.
1310.6936: A survey of 16 stars with resolved debris discs finds no evidence of significant misalignment between the star and disc, suggesting that dynamical effects near the star do not operate on outer system planetesimals.
1401.3576: The paper provides a complete, decidable, first-order classification of unification problems over bounded distributive lattices, Kleene algebras, and de Morgan algebras with respect to their unification type, establishing that unification over the varieties of de Morgan and Kleene algebras is nullary.
cond-mat9506112: The authors develop a theory to explain the phase diagram of the heavy fermion superconductor Upt, which exhibits multiple superconducting phases and a complex phase diagram. They use the effective field method to analyze the system and find that the phase diagram can be understood in terms of the competition between different order parameters. The theory is able to explain the observed phase diagram, including the upper critical field curve and the inner transition lines, and is consistent with experimental data.
cond-mat0502409: By using a high-level atomistic approach, we predicted spectroscopic characteristics of self-assembled InGaAs/GaAs quantum dots as a function of height and composition, revealing prominent features including biaxial strain effects, shell structure of confined electron states, and localization of hole states at the dot-matrix interface.
astro-ph0209486: We derived constraints from current and future SNIA observations in a scenario where both accelerated expansion and CDM are manifestations of a single component, the generalized Chaplygin gas, which is consistent with current data but may be ruled out by SNAP data.
hep-ph0408271: The paper proposes a new mechanism for baryogenesis and dark matter generation through late-decaying Q-balls, which can explain the coincidence between baryonic matter and dark matter densities.
math-ph0211018: Researchers develop a numerical method for solving the coupled KdV-MKdV system, a nonlinear partial differential equation, using a finite difference scheme that preserves two conservation laws and has a conditional stability.
1212.1061: The Conservative Exchange Market Model (CEMM) on complex networks exhibits a poverty line and low inequality, with high-degree nodes being richer but more prone to fluctuations, and low-degree nodes being poorer.
1504.06250: A novel computational scheme, Extended Symmetric Tensor Decomposition (ESTD), is proposed to efficiently represent the Configuration Interaction (CI) wavefunction, enabling the accurate treatment of strongly correlated systems.
1306.3318: First-principles investigation shows no spin valve effect for single-atom magnetic junctions with magnetic adatoms under zero bias, but a large change in total conductance is observed for junctions with non-magnetic adatoms.
1204.3525: A novel set of electromagnetic boundary conditions, dubbed shdb conditions, is defined, generalizing the soft-and-hard and db conditions, and its properties are studied, including reflection of a plane wave and numerical computations.
1607.02075: A radial basis function approach is extended to include odd-even effects, significantly improving nuclear mass predictions and single-nucleon separation energies, with rms deviations reduced to less than 0.2 keV.
1209.4305: Observations of dense molecular gas in galaxies reveal a bimodal star-formation law, with higher efficiency in luminous infrared galaxies compared to normal galaxies.
1501.07039: This paper proves that chaotic Boltzmann machines with two elements exhibit quasi-periodic dynamics and yield samples from the probabilistic distribution of the corresponding Boltzmann machines, provided the rotation number is irrational.
1305.1105: A study of 11 nearby Ib/c supernovae explosion sites reveals that Ib/c supernovae are produced in lower metallicity environments than Ic supernovae, with a mean metallicity of 0.83 solar for Ib sites and 1.09 solar for Ic sites.
astro-ph0312059: Skysoft is a community-supported astronomical software directory, allowing users to contribute and share software news, comments, and bugs, aiming to provide a more specialized and up-to-date platform for astronomers and instrument developers.
1006.2051: The authors study the performance of simple error correcting and error avoiding quantum codes together with their concatenation for correlated noise models, showing that the concatenated code is particularly advantageous for model ii in the regime of partial correlations.
1608.08762: A fractional random walk model is derived for regular undirected networks, with a focus on cubic lattices in 5-dimensional space. The model exhibits long-range jumps and a small-world property, increasing the efficiency of the random walk. The fractional transition matrix and return probabilities show a power-law decay, indicating the emergence of Lévy flights. The mean relaxation time and Kemeny constant are also calculated, showing that the fractional random walk is faster than the normal random walk for smaller values of the
1105.5418: This paper derives exact results for the spectral density of Schmidt eigenvalues and average von Neumann entropy for random pure states in three invariant classes of random matrix ensembles, showing maximum entanglement is achieved in the symplectic invariant class.
1701.07295: The paper introduces a notion of independent natural extension for coherent conditional lower previsions, which always exists and satisfies factorisation and external additivity, extending previous results for finite spaces.
1504.02966: The Susceptible-Exposed-Infected (SEI) model exhibits a continuous phase transition with critical behavior within the universality class of dynamical percolation, displaying similar stationary properties to site percolation.
1205.1631: The paper discusses the application of the theory of quantum groups to the formulation of integrable systems and derivation of functional relations. It introduces the universal R-matrix and its relation to the Yang-Baxter equation, and defines the universal monodromy matrix and transfer operator. The paper also discusses the construction of the universal R-matrix for the quantum group U_q(sl(2)) and its application to the six-vertex model.
cond-mat0010368: Researchers develop two efficient methods to calculate permeability of porous media using Brownian motion simulations, the "penetration depth" and "unit capacitance" methods, which agree well with existing numerical solutions and theoretical bounds.
1404.2868: A quantum field theory model is proposed for simulating fermion-fermion scattering, pair creation, and non-perturbative regimes using a superconducting circuit with tunable coupling transmon qubits and resonators.
0909.0742: Future pulsar timing measurements will be capable of detecting individual gravitational wave bursts from supermassive black hole mergers with a signal-to-noise ratio of 1.64, occurring at a rate of a few hundredths per year.
cond-mat0109520: The distribution function for the dimensionless critical current through a chaotic quantum dot is a Gaussian for a large number of channels, with its position and width being the average critical current and root-mean-square fluctuations, respectively.
cond-mat0101079: The inherent structure approach provides a thermodynamic framework for understanding glass forming liquids, relating configurational entropy and fragility to the energy landscape of the liquid.
astro-ph9508083: A search for ultra-high energy (UHE) emission from Gamma-Ray Bursts (GRBs) using the University College Dublin air shower array yielded no evidence for coincident UHE emission from seven GRBs, but a significant delayed excess of air showers was found for GRB910511.
0706.3797: Neutrinos are probably no Majorana fields due to the contradiction between the Majorana condition and the Standard Model interactions, making a Majorana mass term incompatible with observation.
cond-mat0211570: A fluid of bound hole pairs forms in a strongly correlated electron system with alternating hole-rich and hole-poor domains, enabling superfluid phase ordering at a relatively high critical temperature.
physics0310156: The CDF diffractive physics program uses two Miniplug calorimeters to measure event energy flow in the very forward rapidity region, achieving a response of over 100 photoelectrons to minimum ionizing particles.
1009.2251: Confinement effects on semiflexible polymers' relaxation dynamics are investigated, revealing novel signatures and scaling laws for longitudinal response and tension propagation under various force scenarios.
nucl-th0002007: The authors develop the formalism of the interacting boson model (IBM-2) to study the relation and coupling of the collective octupole degree of freedom to proton-neutron mixed-symmetry states in near-spherical nuclei.
physics0608109: A simple model is presented describing the relation between the relaxation rate of ground-state coherences and magnetic-field inhomogeneities in buffer-gas-free anti-relaxation-coated cells, confirmed by experiments using nonlinear magneto-optical rotation.
1609.09862: A Legendre-Fourier spectral method is proposed for the Vlasov-Poisson system, ensuring conservation of mass, momentum, and energy, and enforcing L2 stability with a penalty term.
astro-ph9909482: HyperCat maintains a comprehensive galaxy database with spatially resolved and global properties, enabling studies of scaling relations and facilitating data comparison across different redshifts.
1311.3102: Stable bright solitons and vortices are predicted in dipolar condensates induced by spatially inhomogeneous polarizing fields, exhibiting super-exponential localization and robustness against external perturbations.
0812.0685: Researchers calibrate and utilize nuclear track detectors (NTDs) to measure fragmentation cross sections and search for rare particles, achieving upper limits for downgoing intermediate mass monopoles and other exotic particles.
0906.0951: The authors investigate the presence of an intermediate-mass black hole in the Ursa Minor dwarf spheroidal galaxy, finding that a black hole with a mass exceeding 10^5 solar masses would disrupt the galaxy's cold substructure within a Hubble time.
1109.5301: The authors derive algebro-geometric solutions to the Camassa-Holm equation using Fay's identity and provide a numerical study of these solutions on real hyperelliptic curves.
0905.1267: A protocol for quasi-perfect state transfer in a linear network of dissipative oscillators is developed, enabling the transfer of a state between ideal sender and receiver oscillators through a linear chain of nonideal transmitter oscillators.
hep-lat9708011: The authors investigate the order of the Coulomb-Higgs transition in the U(1)-Higgs model, finding a crossover from first-order to second-order transition at a certain value of the coupling constant.
astro-ph0301318: The study reveals that short-duration Gamma-Ray Bursts exhibit a common feature of post-burst emission, detected in 51% of 100 events, with a stable radiation background and comparable flux magnitude.
1604.01510: Researchers study dark post-flare loops (dpfls) in solar flares, finding they contain blob-like features with velocities of 76 km/s, and their cooling time is dominated by radiation.
1210.6333: Researchers investigate the discrepancy between theoretical predictions and observed orbital periods of ultracompact X-ray binaries, proposing donor wind and magnetic propeller effects as explanations for their evolution and reduced luminosity.
hep-ex0504042: Researchers propose a new method to search for the neutron electric dipole moment (edm) using Laue diffraction of cold neutrons in noncentrosymmetric crystals, which can increase the sensitivity by more than an order of magnitude.
1208.3844: This paper calculates the dilepton production in the Randall-Sundrum model with one warped extra dimension and small curvature, obtaining LHC discovery limits on the 5-dimensional Planck scale.
nucl-th0601032: The authors acknowledge previous works on QCD, Regge theory, and experimental data, but no new solution is presented in this article.
1302.0208: The massive outflow in the DR21 region is likely produced by the disintegration of a non-hierarchical stellar system, similar to the explosive event in Orion BN/KL, but 20 times more energetic.
astro-ph0602607: A modified gravity theory, Relativistic Modified Gravity (RMG), explains galaxy rotation curves and galaxy cluster data without non-baryonic dark matter, using a modified Newtonian acceleration law and a light, electrically uncharged vector particle called a "phion" that forms a Bose-Einstein condensate, dominating the density of matter at cosmological scales.
1107.3598: A sufficient condition for a substitution tiling system to have pure discrete spectrum is that the balanced pair algorithm terminates with coincidence, and a necessary condition is that the return vectors of the substitution are densely eventually coincident with the tilings.
hep-ph0211042: Supersymmetry models, particularly Minimal Supersymmetric Standard Model (MSSM), are constrained by experiments, with the Tevatron and future linear colliders potentially scanning the remaining parameter space.
astro-ph0102175: This paper calculates the height of the pair formation front (PFF) in pulsars, where the accelerating potential is shorted out by pair production, in the presence of inverse Compton scattering and a Muslimov-Tsygan accelerating potential.
1503.08048: Researchers investigate the effectiveness of targeted and random subsidy policies in controlling the spread of epidemics on complex networks, finding that the targeted policy can produce positive effects when individuals imitate the vaccination strategies of high-degree nodes, but can be counterproductive when individuals imitate the strategies of non-subsidized nodes.
1308.1663: A frequency scaling law is introduced to compare the energy distributions of emitted radiation in nonlinear Compton and Thomson processes by shaped laser pulses, showing that the two spectra coincide after applying the scaling law, with the importance of spin effects in nonlinear Compton scattering stressed.
1205.1058: The latitude-albedo effect, a false positive for ocean glint, occurs when a planet's apparent albedo increases at crescent phases due to year-round snow in cold regions, mimicking glint signatures.
1401.6770: Researchers study edge states in 2D lattice electron systems, particularly in anisotropic square and triangular lattice ribbons, using tight-binding models and Chebyshev polynomials to solve eigenvalue problems.
1305.0558: The study investigates the relationship between maximum young cluster masses and gas surface density in the grand-design galaxy M51, finding no correlation for older clusters but a hint of correlation for younger clusters, suggesting that the normalization of the relationship depends on cluster mass and/or age ranges.
cond-mat9703102: Researchers introduce a disorder-induced mechanism to explain the instability of the spin-liquid phase in the doped spin-Peierls compound CuGeO3, which gives way to a Néel phase upon doping.
cond-mat0210670: The authors analyze the magnetic phase diagram and structure of the antiferromagnet BacuSiO, revealing strong relativistic effects due to its low dimensionality, leading to additional spin-reorientation transitions and deviations from the Bonner-Fisher law.
1210.7194: Researchers develop a formalism for spin injection from half-metallic electrodes into normal metals, accounting for thermal spin fluctuations and spin disorder, and demonstrate efficient spin injection at finite temperatures.
cs0611052: The paper proves that random 2-SAT formulas have exponentially many well-separated clusters of satisfying assignments, and that within each cluster, a majority of variables are frozen, taking only one value.
astro-ph0512094: The discovery of low-mass pre-main sequence stars in the Large Magellanic Cloud association LH 52, with an initial mass spectrum slope similar to a Salpeter IMF.
0712.0340: The nucleon's static properties and reactions to external probes remain poorly understood, with recent measurements of form factors and generalized parton distributions (GPDs) revealing discrepancies with perturbative QCD predictions.
astro-ph0010128: The starburst galaxy ARP 244 is a merger of two gas-rich spiral galaxies, with a large quantity of molecular gas available at low density, a low star formation efficiency, and a moderate FIR luminosity, indicating it has the potential to produce an ultraluminous extreme starburst in its late stage of merging.
1702.07114: Researchers reproduce Dirac cone pairs in silicene/Ag(111) using first-principles DFT calculations, revealing that the cones are induced by strong interface Si-Ag hybridization, not intrinsic properties of silicene or Ag.
1512.07772: Researchers discover spontaneous quantum hall effects in chiral 2D electron systems, driven by electron-electron interactions, leading to novel many-body physics and topological invariants.
nucl-th0610093: The authors study neutrino-nucleus reactions in the Δ-resonance region using the Sato-Lee model, which treats resonant and non-resonant contributions in a unified manner, and obtain reasonably good descriptions of relevant electron scattering data.
1608.05360: The authors introduce a unified Bayesian framework for simultaneous adaptive model selection and parameter estimation, enabling efficient detection and characterization of a sparse bath of incoherent spurious two-level systems in superconducting qubits.
1606.03648: This work explores the estimation of three-neutron forces in neutron matter using empirical constraints, with a focus on the neutron skin of neutron-rich nuclei, and finds that the experimental error of neutron skin determinations should be less than 0.03 fm to be effective in constraining missing contributions from few-nucleon forces.
hep-ph0012021: This paper presents RG-improved tree-level branching ratios for Higgs boson decays in the MSSM, exploring their dependence on various parameters and excluding regions by kinematics and theoretical conditions.
1502.06861: The authors address the cosmic coincidence problem in the framework of f(r,t) gravity, a modified gravity theory that can explain late cosmic acceleration without dark energy, by introducing an interaction between matter and dark energy sectors.
1210.3893: Experimental demonstration of long vortex filament merger using counter-rotating vortices in a high-aspect-ratio tank, visualized through Particle Image Velocimetry (PIV).
1112.0196: Researchers design sub-wavelength grating mirrors for mid-infrared Vertical-Cavity Surface-Emitting Lasers (VCSELs) with improved reflectivity and tolerance to fabrication errors.
1308.2153: The Minimal Supersymmetric Standard Model (MSSM) offers solutions compatible with a light WIMP and large scattering cross-section, as suggested by CDMS and other data, if the reported events are due to a DM signal.
1501.06522: This paper defines a notion of model for the λ0-calculus modulo theory, a super-consistent theory, and proves that proof-reduction terminates in the λ0-calculus modulo a super-consistent theory.
cond-mat9709095: Researchers develop an exact semiclassical approach to the many-mode Jahn-Teller problem, providing a detailed description of the low-energy vibronic spectrum and accurate ground-state energy estimates in the strong-coupling limit.
0912.0621: This paper presents the first phase of a programme aimed at improving knowledge about the polarization properties of radio sources at high radio frequencies, using observations of 199 bright sources from the WMAP sample.
0906.4433: This paper proves that a discounted action functional on a compact Riemannian manifold admits smooth optimal synthesis if and only if there exists a complete vector field on the manifold such that any positive semi-trajectory of the dynamical system is a unique minimizer of the functional.
1508.05597: A mathematical model of fish schooling is developed using ordinary differential equations, incorporating weighted averages of nearest neighbors' positions and orientations, with stochastic and deterministic components, and local and global existence of solutions are proven under certain conditions.
astro-ph0603368: The authors re-analyze the bounds on sterile neutrino mass and mixing angle imposed by the observations of Coma and Virgo galaxy clusters, improving the previous limit by a factor of 24 in the region of interest.
1408.4476: The paper calculates the time-averaged nonlinear conductivity of a dirty type-II superconductor using the Usadel equations and the Mattis-Bardeen result, and estimates the effect of current on the superconducting gap.
1411.5483: A novel extension of general relativity is proposed, incorporating two property coordinates and non-abelian gauge fields, leading to a unified theory of gravity and Yang-Mills theory.
hep-ph0409046: A new method is proposed to isolate the prompt atmospheric neutrino flux by focusing on charged-current events that initiate showers, reducing the conventional atmospheric neutrino background and allowing for the detection of new physics signals.
nucl-th0110047: A mixed-mode shell model scheme is proposed to accommodate single-particle and collective-quadrupole degrees of freedom in atomic nuclei, achieving good dimensional convergence and spectral structure with a relatively small model space.
nucl-th0102036: Electromagnetic two-nucleon knockout reactions provide a direct tool to explore nuclear structure and correlations, with a combined analysis of cross sections and polarization observables required for this study.
1404.2930: The authors present a study of the stellar-to-halo mass ratio (SHMR) using the South Pole Telescope Deep Field Survey (SSDF) and the halo occupation distribution (HOD) framework, providing the most robust measurement to date of the SHMR peak at z=0.9.
1403.0776: This paper proves a conjecture of Seymour, generalizing a result of Posa, that if a graph has minimum Ore-degree at least 2k, then it contains the kth power of a Hamiltonian cycle.
0910.1791: This paper examines the local structure and polarization involved in chloride ion hydration using a quantum mechanical/molecular mechanical (QM/MM) treatment, finding that water-water interactions dominate over ion-water interactions in determining the polarization state of inner-shell waters.
astro-ph0608705: The distribution of blue plume populations in the Milky Way's outer disk suggests a connection to the Norma-Cygnus and Perseus spiral arms, with possible evidence of galactic warp.
1001.5126: Researchers develop a new approach to study magnetic phase stability of magnetic overlayers on non-magnetic substrates by evaluating exchange integrals between local magnetic moments using the adiabatic approximation and real-space green function approach.
0803.1644: Detection of water maser emission in three possible post-asymptotic giant branch (post-AGB) stars confirms the third known water-maser-emitting planetary nebula (PN).
cmp-lg9606004: This paper formalizes the insertion problem in feature-based default inheritance hierarchies, where an object's features are inherited from a set of classes, and proposes an approximation algorithm to solve it efficiently.
cond-mat0608169: A numerical renormalization group study of the double quantum dot system reveals a rich phase diagram with a quantum phase transition from a strong coupling phase to a charge ordered phase at a critical interdot interaction strength.
1309.5212: Researchers derive an exact decomposition of the modified transition matrix for a forest-fire model, leading to system size independence of the large deviation function for frequency of events, and numerically calculate the ldf for frequency of events in the model.
cond-mat0004394: Theoretical study of quantum conductance oscillations in metallic ultrasmall contacts containing impurities, showing a nonlinear dependence on bias voltage due to electron wave interference.
hep-ex0608059: This paper calculates neutrino event rates for detectors at various locations in the NUMI neutrino beam, considering flux, probability, cross sections, and energy reconstruction.
1703.10464: Researchers develop a pair-mode concept to study the orientational disorder of organic cations in hybrid perovskites, enabling the simulation of disordered structures and the prediction of domain structures.
cond-mat0506752: The authors derive the self-energies up to the fourth-order for the Anderson model in the nonequilibrium Kondo regime and investigate the behavior of the Kondo resonance under finite bias voltage.
cs0406014: This paper presents a data structure called "fat pointers" for navigating and editing trees in declarative languages, achieving constant time and space complexity for tree traversal and editing operations.
1302.2317: Graphene supports two types of surface plasmon-polaritons (SPPs), transverse magnetic (TM) and transverse electric (TE), with unique properties and applications in plasmonics, spectroscopy, and sensing.
1603.06824: The Alice detector at the LHC studies strongly interacting matter at extreme energy density and temperature, analyzing event-by-event fluctuations to understand the QGP and phase transition in QCD.
0811.1897: A new method to measure the spin of supermassive black holes is proposed, using the ratio of outflow energy to black hole mass, which is found to be constant for powerful radio galaxies, suggesting a threshold for outflow triggering.
1111.6626: Spectropolarimetry of SN 2011fe reveals changing polarization angle of Si II absorption lines, suggesting global asymmetry in the ejecta, potentially with axial symmetry.
1506.07054: This paper derives the asymptotic probability distribution of the cubic metric (CM) for continuous OFDM signals and investigates the oversampling rate required to capture the CM of continuous OFDM signals.
astro-ph0401614: The eclipse of pulsar A in the double pulsar system PSR J0737-3039 is found to be asymmetric, frequency-dependent, and variable, suggesting a complex interaction between the two neutron stars.
1306.5544: Researchers combine Planck data with galaxy power spectrum measurements from the BOSS experiment to derive constraints on the sum of neutrino masses, finding a limit of 0.32 eV at 2σ confidence level.
cond-mat0108429: A Monte Carlo algorithm with absorbing Markov chains (MCAMC) is reviewed for simulating long-time dynamics in discrete systems, achieving faster-than-real-time simulations without changing the underlying dynamic.
cond-mat0509167: The authors report a detailed study of the nodal metal state in YBCO, a prototypical high-Tc superconductor, using untwinned single crystals for ten different dopings between 6.28 and 7.00. They unveil the evolution of the electromagnetic response as doping progresses from AF-ordered phase to superconducting materials, and show that the ir signatures of the nodal metal involve a two-component conductivity: the Drude mode at low energies followed by a resonance in
1008.1532: Researchers propose a time-dependent density matrix functional theory (TDDMFT) approach to study biexcitonic effects in solids, reproducing experimental biexcitonic binding energies with phenomenological interaction kernels.
1312.4695: This work proposes a method to learn phase-invariant sparse complex representations of natural sounds, demonstrating that learned features are invariant to many stimulus aspects, not only phase, and that prior-based dictionaries can be used without quality loss to represent natural sounds in tasks such as spatial hearing.
1607.01737: Researchers study the "swoosh" phenomenon in pulsars b0919+06 and b1859+07, observing complex, quasi-periodic shifts in emission longitude, and explore possible mechanisms, including orbital dynamics, but find no conclusive explanation.
1001.0228: A symmetric monoidal structure is established on the category of non-commutative motives, making the universal localizing invariant symmetric monoidal, and providing a new tool for studying non-commutative motives.
physics0606156: A boundary-integral equation method is presented for calculating poloidal axisymmetric magnetic fields applicable in a wide range of ac frequencies, reducing the problem to a surface integral.
astro-ph0007211: The authors apply a spherical collapse model to the Shapley Supercluster, estimating its mass and density profile, and find that the central region is likely collapsing under its own gravity, with a mass enhancement over the average universe density, but still insufficient to produce the observed local group motion.
hep-ph9902468: This work compares the neutral higgs scalars of NMSSM and E6SSM models, focusing on their similarities and differences in the neutral higgs sector, particularly in the HTCDM scenario where the trilinear soft mass coupling is large.
1503.00268: Researchers study the cusp summations and relations of five quad lens models using magnification invariants, finding that cusp summations are usually not equal to 0 and depend on the second parameter describing the deviation from the circular lens.
0704.1830: The design of a segmented electromagnetic calorimeter used in the JLab RCS experiment is described, achieving good energy and position resolution in a high luminosity and high background environment.
1112.3252: A topological quantum memory based on the 3D cubic code is proposed to be self-correcting, with a memory time that grows polynomially with the lattice size at low temperatures, and a storage error upper bound that is exponentially small in the lattice size.
1506.06701: A quantum teleportation protocol for propagating quantum microwaves is proposed, with a focus on the microwave regime, where losses are significant and photodetectors are not available. The protocol's feasibility is analyzed, and a quantum repeater scheme based on weak measurements and postselection is introduced to overcome the limitations of entanglement distribution.
hep-ph9607366: The authors calculate the asymptotic behavior of heavy-meson form factors at large recoil using methods developed for hard exclusive QCD processes, finding that it is determined by the leading- and subleading-twist meson wave functions, with the isgur- wise function dominated by the interference between the wave functions of leading and subleading twist at 1 < z < 1.
1208.0451: Researchers develop a new directed random market model that shows a clear relation between money and influence of an agent on the system, with more connected agents accumulating more money.
hep-ph9909298: The recent Cleo measurement of B→ππ favors small α₅, which enhances the penguin amplitude and implies a large error in the determination of the CKM phase α₁ using only B→ππ decays.
1303.0888: This paper formalizes the concept of lambda words, a sequence of differences between ordered elements, and shows that they are rich words, meaning they contain a maximal number of distinct palindromes.
physics0606165: Researchers develop a theoretical framework for radio-frequency (rf) induced adiabatic potentials in ultracold atomic gases, enabling the creation of versatile atom optical elements and interference experiments.
1011.6054: The orbital period of the transient low-mass X-ray binary XTE J1710-281 is measured to be 0.1367109674(3) d with a period derivative of -1.6 to 0.2 × 10^(-10) d/d, indicating a possible orbital period glitch.
1206.1128: This paper derives the effective hamiltonian constraint and modified Friedmann equation in loop quantum cosmology using coherent state functional integral, which suggests the emergence of the Moyal star product in the gravitational part of the hamiltonian.
1107.2614: Researchers develop a method to track and calculate the rotational motions of clusters of colloidal particles using existing particle tracking routines and rigid body transformations, enabling the study of rotational dynamics in colloidal systems.
cond-mat9907092: Researchers investigate electron transport through atomic wires, finding that electron standing waves form due to interference at the wire-contact interface, affecting conductance oscillations in heterogeneous systems.
astro-ph9512028: Researchers use ROSAT PSPC data to measure the X-ray luminosity function of galaxy clusters, testing claims of cluster evolution and measuring the local XLF with improved spatial resolution and sensitivity.
math0107142: The paper studies the structure of genus 2 fields with elliptic subfields of degree 2, classifying their automorphism groups and the locus of such fields in the moduli space of genus 2 curves.
