1012.5497: We investigate pairing effects in ultra-small nanoparticles containing hundreds of atoms, focusing on aluminum, zinc, and potassium. Our results show that aluminum is the best candidate for observing pairing effects, with an average energy gap of 0.025eV when considering deformations and coulomb interaction. The energy gap is larger by two orders of magnitude than the energy gap in bulk aluminum and lies in an intermediate energy scale between the lowest single-electron excitation energy and the inter-shell energy spacing.
cond-mat0110273: A stochastic multiplicative model reproduces power-law behaviors in wealth and return distributions, as well as volatility clustering, due to cross-correlations between relative updated wealths.
1612.04181: Researchers investigate the formation of chemical gardens in a 2D Hele-Shaw cell, observing three patterns: algae, shells, and filaments, and develop a mathematical model to explain the filament pattern's dynamics.
hep-th9502083: A perturbation expansion method is presented to incorporate physical degrees of freedom into the pure-gauge model, leading to color confinement in the Kugo-Ojima mechanism.
hep-ph9810243: The authors calculate the coupling constants of photons with heavy baryons and the lowest three heavy meson doublets using light cone QCD sum rules with photon wave functions in the leading order of Heavy Quark Effective Theory.
quant-ph0507140: Researchers derive a simple, physically transparent geometrical structure for a system of one oscillator linearly coupled to multiple oscillators, enabling the study of decoherence and quantum information.
hep-th0406146: The authors extend the Cachazo-Svrcek-Witten (CSW) rules for calculating tree-level gauge theory amplitudes to include quarks and gluinos, and use these rules to compute various googly amplitudes with quarks and gluinos.
1612.07173: Researchers study the interacting and non-interacting slow relaxation dynamics in a many-body localization system, observing power-law decays emerging in the interacting case and a localized non-interacting system.
physics0302029: The aging test of an RPC prototype for the LHCb muon system shows a large increase in plate resistivity and dark current after integrating 0.45 C, but the irradiated RPC remains efficient up to the maximum expected rate.
1211.1113: The authors investigate the Baldwin effect in narrow emission lines of active galactic nuclei (AGNs) and find a nearly constant slope of -0.2 for most lines, contradicting the ionization energy dependence seen in broad lines.
1005.2309: The authors propose a method to extract the elastic cross section of pion-pion scattering by analyzing the reaction π-π→n-neutron, using Regge theory and including absorption effects, and predict large cross sections with significant interference effects.
cond-mat0611706: Researchers use time-resolved magnetic imaging to reconstruct current density and electric field in a superconducting film, enabling a complete characterization of its electromagnetic properties.
astro-ph0210242: This study examines the effect of galaxy environment on star formation, using a sample of 100,000 galaxies from the 2DFGRS survey. It finds that star formation decreases with increasing local density, but the fraction of starburst galaxies remains constant, suggesting that tidal interactions may trigger starbursts in all environments.
1612.05964: Researchers develop a theoretical model for a nonlinear double-slit experiment with a Kerr nonlinear material, predicting intensity profiles and phase accumulation with excellent agreement to numerical simulations, enabling measurement of nonlinear properties of materials.
astro-ph0505135: Cosmic reionization is affected by minihalos, which can increase global ionizing photon consumption by a factor of up to 2, slowing down and extending reionization in time.
1304.3525: The authors investigate the evolution of a crystal surface using a family of simple atomistic models, specifically the solid-on-solid (SOS) model, and derive two partial differential equation (PDE) limits in different scaling regimes, providing numerical evidence supporting their claims.
1601.00545: Researchers propose a novel valley filter in bilayer graphene using electrostatic potentials, achieving almost perfect valley filtering with low electron energy, long channel length, and narrow channel width.
1402.1761: This paper examines the scalability of wireless networks, highlighting the impact of bottlenecks and erasures on network performance, and proposes methods to mitigate these issues, including mobility, hierarchical networks, and erasure recovery protocols.
nucl-ex0311005: A high-statistics, multi-hadron final state electron scattering experiment, CLAS, at Jefferson Lab, enables precision measurements of neutrino-nucleus interactions, crucial for understanding neutrino oscillations and nuclear physics.
1608.00275: A Keynesian economics-inspired Ising model of a network of firms reveals a metastable feature, where a minimum bound for a successful fiscal stimulation exists, and a relatively small but fast stimulation in the "golden time passage" after a shock is more effective than a larger one after unemployment rises.
1702.01784: This paper presents 19 new brown dwarf (BD) candidates discovered using the MARVELS survey, a radial velocity (RV) exoplanet search project. The candidates were identified through a combination of RV measurements, periodogram analysis, and vetting procedures to minimize false positives.
astro-ph0602302: Solar flare elements exhibit a soft-hard-soft spectral behavior, contradicting the standard reconnection model, and are caused by a spatial displacement along the arcade triggered by a propagating disturbance.
physics9907019: A fiber detector made of 12 planes with 16 pixels each was irradiated with a low energy high rate beam of positive pions, resulting in a total dose of 1-4 mrad. Unexpectedly, no radiation damage was observed in the detector fibers, but a large and irreversible damage was seen in the lucite degrader.
1504.07717: The paper investigates the asymptotics of the excursion probability of non-smooth bivariate Gaussian random fields, which is crucial for modeling multivariate measurements obtained at spatial locations.
1612.04140: A general formula is derived for the calculation of alpha-decay width using the regular coulomb function, resonant wave function, and the difference in potentials, leading to a closed formula for the logarithm of half-life as a function of q-values of various decaying nuclei.
astro-ph9702108: Dusty models better explain observed spectral energy distributions of low-mass stars, particularly in the short-wavelength region, than dust-free models.
0906.4761: A functor is constructed from the combinatorial braid cobordism category to the category of complexes in @xmath7 up to homotopy, lifting Rouquier's construction, where each crossing is associated with a Rouquier complex.
1702.05872: Researchers propose a new approach for synthesizing acoustic metasurfaces with perfect anomalous reflection and transmission, overcoming efficiency limitations of conventional designs by suppressing parasitic reflections and ensuring local power conservation.
cs0003070: This paper presents a translation system that maps logic programs into lazy functional programs, specifically in the Haskell language, demonstrating that some features considered exclusive to logic programming can be found in lazy functional programming. The translation system preserves the implicit failure mechanism and backtracking of logic programs, and it is shown that some logic programs using complex logical variables and dynamic scheduling can be safely translated into Haskell. The paper also discusses the possibility of returning multiple answers, which is a peculiar feature of logic programs, and proposes a classification of
0711.0321: This paper studies rare B decays in the R-parity violating (RPV) supersymmetric standard model, deriving new upper limits on relevant RPV coupling products and predicting RPV effects on branching ratios and forward-backward asymmetries.
1008.5136: Researchers use computational chemistry to simulate the infrared spectra of interstellar dust, combining small carbon-rich molecular building blocks to reproduce observed spectra, and propose chemiluminescence as an alternative excitation process to stochastic heating.
1102.5241: The paper proves that the finite-dimensional distributions of a random walk in a random environment converge to those of a self-similar stochastic process with scaling exponent 1/β.
1402.3894: The pseudo-@xmath2 expansion technique is used to calculate the Fisher critical exponent, yielding a series with a favorable structure for numerical estimates, converging to accurate asymptotes, and persisting for a wide range of @xmath1 values.
0906.5424: A study of 11 planetary nebulae in the Small Magellanic Cloud reveals a predominance of carbon-rich nebulae, indicating low-mass and low-metallicity progenitors, consistent with stellar evolution models.
1109.3452: The paper proposes sterile neutrinos as a candidate for Warm Dark Matter (WDM) in the keV mass scale, which can naturally be embedded in the Standard Model of particle physics.
0808.2896: We synthesized and investigated two new ternary compounds, pr@xmath0pd@xmath1ge@xmath2 and pr@xmath0rh@xmath1ge@xmath2, exhibiting antiferromagnetic ordering and heavy fermion behavior due to crystal field effects.
1601.03683: The complement of the proper power graph of a group is studied, and it is shown that it is complete if and only if the group is abelian of exponent 2. It is also shown that the complement is bipartite if and only if the group is isomorphic to a specific set of groups. The graph is disconnected if and only if the group has a unique subgroup of prime order, and the number of components is determined. The graph is connected if and only if the group is non
1002.4815: The study of V393 Sco reveals a complex binary system with mass loss through the Lagrangian point, a hot optically thick envelope, and a permanent hot wind at high latitudes, contributing to its long-term variability.
cond-mat0506161: A diagrammatic scheme is presented for the variational coupled-cluster method to calculate distribution functions, reproducing the spin-wave theory and providing a convergent, precise result for the order parameter of the one-dimensional isotropic model.
1211.5941: Researchers investigate the existence of essential closed fake surfaces in the 3-sphere, related to non-trivial knots and links, and their properties under specific smoothing operations.
1304.1925: Researchers identified two triple-current-sheet events in solar wind data, supporting the scenario where current sheets are boundaries of flux tubes originating from the sun, and not solely generated in-situ by turbulence.
1504.06724: Researchers investigate nonlinear mechanical cooling processes in quadratically optomechanical systems, achieving nonclassical states and suppressed phonon number fluctuations through two-phonon transitions.
cond-mat0202378: Variational perturbation theory is applied to a nonlinear stochastic model to calculate the conditional probability density, achieving accurate results for all coupling constants.
hep-lat0702027: The authors acknowledge previous work on lattice gauge theory and QCD simulations, citing various references for further discussion and data.
hep-ph9505279: The authors calculate the total and differential cross sections of charm and beauty quark photoproduction via the photon-gluon fusion QCD subprocess in the semihard approach, which describes experimental data for charm photoproduction cross section at low and HERA energies.
1007.3473: Measurements of strange particle fragmentation functions in p+p collisions are presented, with Pythia describing some data well but deviating for others, and suggesting hard processes dominate production above 1 GeV/c.
0712.3244: This paper investigates the colossal magnetoresistance (CMR) material Pr0.7Sr0.3MnO3 using first-principles band structure calculations, revealing half-metallic character with a band gap in the minority band and strong spin-dependent hybridization of Mn and O states upon hole doping.
hep-ph9907297: The authors re-analyze the strange and anti-strange distributions in the nucleon sea using the meson cloud model and the light-cone model, and find that the predictions for the shape of the asymmetry are opposite and parameter-independent, making it possible to distinguish between the two models with more precise experimental data.
1403.2216: The paper studies the holonomy of zero modes in a system of static disjoint fluxons with non-quantized fluxes, showing that the holonomy is non-abelian and topological when the fluxons are identical and the number of free modes is maximal.
1102.4956: A polarization calibrator for CMB polarization receivers is developed, providing a well-characterized polarization signal modulated by a rotating mirror, enabling simultaneous measurements of responsivity, polarization angle, and spurious polarization signal with sufficient precision.
1302.3950: Researchers propose a model resolving the paradox of traversable "big brake" singularity in the universe by redefining the anti-Chaplygin gas using distributional functions.
astro-ph0306147: The authors normalize the inverse-power-law-potential scalar field dark energy model by comparing predicted CMB anisotropy to DMR data, finding a small range of model parameter values remain observationally viable.
1109.3621: Researchers develop an effective chiral model to study the phase diagram of strongly interacting nuclear matter, predicting a smooth crossover phase transition at zero baryochemical potential and no critical end point at finite chemical potentials.
1605.00225: Researchers propose an improved method for estimating the neutron background in neutron capture experiments, which is essential for accurate measurements of capture cross sections. The new approach relies on simulations of the complete experimental setup, accounting for the detector response to scattered neutrons and their temporal evolution.
astro-ph0110361: The study uses solar f-mode observations to infer the rotation profile in the subsurface shear layer of the Sun, finding a negative gradient at low latitudes and a transition to a small or positive gradient at higher latitudes.
1608.07263: The paper examines the habitability of Proxima B, a potentially habitable exoplanet, and finds that its low stellar flux allows for habitable conditions with an order of magnitude less atmosphere, making it a promising candidate for life.
0803.2332: Researchers study the classical Heisenberg antiferromagnet on the pyrochlore lattice with first and second-neighbor exchange interactions, discovering a partially ordered phase at intermediate temperatures with collinear spins and a layered structure.
astro-ph9701115: Researchers study the evolution of early-type galaxies at intermediate redshifts using the fundamental plane relation, finding evidence for passive evolution and a high formation redshift.
0706.3194: The Vela pulsar's X-ray emission is thermal in nature, with a complex modulation of its spectral components as a function of rotational phase, suggesting a non-uniform surface temperature distribution or magnetospheric reprocessing.
hep-ex9902027: Evidence for neutrino oscillations with a mass difference of 5.0 x 10^-5 eV^2 and maximal mixing is found by Super-Kamiokande and Kamiokande experiments, indicating that neutrinos have mass.
nucl-th0403054: Jet-plasma interactions provide a new source of virtual photons competing with the Drell-Yan process, and dileptons can tag jets to provide valuable information on their characteristics at formation time.
cond-mat0002133: We have calculated the grand canonical potential of two spheres immersed in a bulk fluid phase using density functional theory, revealing an effective wetting-induced interaction potential between the spheres. The shape of the potential depends on the morphology of the wetting film and exhibits a bridging transition between two configurations, which is independent of the thin-thick transition on a single sphere. The bridging transition is determined by the equality of the surface areas of the interfaces in the bridged and unbridged configurations, leading to a
0810.5233: Researchers employed the lowest order constrained variational method to calculate the ground state energy of polarized liquid helium-3 at zero temperature, using spin-dependent correlation functions with Lennard-Jones and Aziz pair potentials.
1308.2221: Researchers apply Noether gauge symmetry to the quintom model, a double-field model of dark energy, to derive a specific form of the interaction potential function, providing a new approach to cosmology beyond phenomenological potential functions.
0810.5236: The paper explores the gauge invariant operators and spin-chains in the context of the AdS/CFT correspondence, focusing on the giant magnon solution and its finite size corrections.
1302.5160: Researchers detected 19 22-GHz H2O masers in the Large Magellanic Cloud, with 8 newly discovered interstellar sources, and estimated the expected number of masers using a luminosity function, finding good agreement with observations.
astro-ph9812040: Researchers model the formation and evolution of high-surface brightness (HSB) and low-surface brightness (LSB) galaxies to explain the origin of Damped Lyman-alpha (DLA) systems, finding LSB galaxies better fit observational data.
1108.4187: Researchers propose a new observational strategy for pixel lensing of the Virgo cluster using the Hubble Space Telescope, aiming to detect short-duration, high-magnification events and estimate the fraction of Machos in the Virgo halo.
hep-th0405175: A supersymmetric field theory with solitonic field configurations exhibits a moduli space of solutions, and the low-energy collective coordinate dynamics on this space and its induced metric have far-reaching consequences. The moduli space of a soliton configuration can exhibit supersymmetry enhancement, where the reduced moduli space preserves more supercharges than one would infer from the bulk superalgebra.
astro-ph0001282: A brown dwarf companion with a mass of approximately 40 Jupiter masses is likely orbiting a G5IV star at a distance of 2 AU, based on the combination of spectroscopic and astrometric data.
astro-ph0004295: Researchers detect vertical motions in the disk of spiral galaxy NGC 5668, associated with star formation processes, suggesting a link between star formation and the origin of high-velocity clouds.
1401.4335: A necessary and sufficient condition for the observability of a networked system is that for every complex scalar and every nonzero complex vector, the matrix-valued polynomial is of full column rank, where is defined as the tfm with transmission zeros.
physics0203091: The authors derive a detailed-balance equation for the stationary probability distribution of open ion channels in a cell membrane, discussing collective effects in a system of coupled ion channels and proposing a frozen diffusion approach to explain exact diagonalization results.
1104.4474: The paper discusses the nature of the Λ(1405) resonance, a negative parity baryon resonance with spin 1/2, isospin 3, and strangeness 4, which is well established experimentally and listed as a four-star resonance in the Particle Data Group.
hep-ph9606397: The authors study the top quark system to probe new physics effects beyond the Standard Model, focusing on the interactions of the top quark with gauge bosons. They use the electroweak chiral Lagrangian to analyze the dimension 5 operators involving the top quark and gauge bosons, and find 19 independent operators. They calculate the helicity amplitudes for the production of top quarks via longitudinal weak boson fusions and find that the anomalous couplings can be
1603.04100: A new discretization method, called the modified virtual grid difference (mvgd), is proposed for solving the Laplace-Beltrami operator on manifolds sampled by point clouds, achieving diagonal dominance and efficient solution by iterative methods.
0710.2137: The paper presents a way to make the heat operator a well-defined, bounded operator in infinite-dimensional Euclidean space by regarding it as mapping from one space defined using a Gaussian measure with a certain variance to another space defined using a different Gaussian measure with a different variance.
astro-ph0106057: Galaxy clusters exhibit substructure and are in early stages of formation, with merging and substructure being common in clusters, and the power ratios providing a quantitative measure of cluster morphology and dynamical state.
1101.1107: A study of the outer arm of the Milky Way galaxy reveals a complex structure with multiple velocity components, suggesting a possible connection to nearby high-velocity clouds, and provides new constraints on the distance and metallicity of the outer arm.
1402.0913: High-energy nuclear collisions research focuses on understanding initial conditions, thermalization, and hydrodynamic evolution, with recent studies indicating collectivity in p/d-A collisions and the importance of fluctuation in initial conditions.
1204.3007: Researchers developed a web-based tool, Pascal, to calculate principal coefficients of thermal expansion and compressibilities from variable-temperature or variable-pressure lattice parameter data, enabling the identification of anomalous mechanical properties in materials.
0903.0329: Researchers detected broad-band noise in four Anomalous X-ray Pulsars (AXPs) and one Soft Gamma Repeater (SGR), likely originating from fall-back disks or magnetar coronae, with changes related to long bursts and outbursts.
astro-ph0605168: A survey of 112 sight lines from the FUSE archive reveals 23 diffuse, hot gas emission lines in the Milky Way, with intensities ranging from 1900 to 8600lu, and an average intensity of 4300lu.
mtrl-th9505011: First-principles calculations reveal the atomic structure, electronic structure, and surface properties of SnO2 (110) surfaces, including stoichiometric and reduced surfaces, with significant implications for gas-sensing devices and oxidation catalysts.
1312.5237: The paper derives the Pauli channel parameters for a Lorentz-boosted wave packet, showing that the output density matrix satisfies the Pauli channel structure.
1609.02287: The paper proposes an interacting dark energy model with a linear combination of dark matter and dark energy energy densities, and constrains the model parameters using recent observational data. The best fit value of the chi-square is achieved for the interacting model with linear parametrization, which is better than the non-interacting models.
1207.6022: The paper investigates the dynamics of a perturbed simple harmonic oscillator and a loaded sphere, revealing two distinct types of orbits: box orbits and loop orbits, characterized by the sign change of angular momentum.
1206.5830: The study investigates the interplay between Active Galactic Nuclei (AGN) and star formation in galaxies, using multi-wavelength diagnostics to disentangle the contributions of AGN and starburst activity to mid-infrared emission.
1308.3854: We analyzed interferometric maps of HCO+ and HCN in two dense cores in the Cygnus-X star forming region, testing the turbulent energy dissipation model and finding evidence for magnetic fields and turbulent motions playing equally important roles in fragmentation.
0706.4013: The hot thermal shell surrounding the southwest radio lobe of Centaurus A is a high-mach number shock, with the electron and proton temperatures unlikely to have equilibrated, and a deeper Chandra observation is required to elucidate the underlying shock physics.
astro-ph0005520: We present new high-resolution observations of interstellar boron and oxygen absorption towards various stars, concluding that boron is incorporated into dust grains in the diffuse interstellar medium, affecting its gas-phase abundance.
1101.0917: Leo Breiman's work in statistics spanned multiple fields, including classification, regression, and ensemble methods, with notable contributions including bagging, random forests, and the nonnegative garrote, which inspired the lasso.
nlin0407009: Researchers apply the multibreathers stability theorem to Klein-Gordon lattices with an impurity, demonstrating that stability properties coincide with homogeneous systems.
1607.07139: This paper studies the emergence of fast sparsely synchronized rhythms in a complex neural network with two sub-populations of short-range and long-range interneurons, and investigates how network topology affects the emergence of these rhythms.
0809.2807: A massive spin-2 field coupled to electromagnetism has an intrinsic UV cutoff, no higher than the particle's mass, due to non-renormalizable interaction terms and superluminal propagation.
1307.0714: Researchers develop and compare various algorithms for muon tomography, a technique using cosmic muons to reconstruct 3D images of objects inside containers, achieving accurate results with the EM-ML method.
astro-ph9705188: The authors investigate the tradeoffs in designing a cosmic microwave background (CMB) mapping experiment to maximize the scientific "bang for the buck". They derive simple analytic expressions to approximate the results of state-of-the-art data analysis techniques, allowing for an intuitive understanding of how experimental parameters affect the ability to constrain cosmological models. The authors provide rules of thumb for experimental design, including choosing a map size that maximizes the signal-to-noise ratio per pixel, avoiding excessively skinny observing regions, and using scan
1012.4130: A second order formalism for spin 1/2 fermions is developed based on the projection over poincar invariant subspaces in the @xmath0 representation of the homogeneous lorentz group, fixing only the mass and spin of the particle but not any other property.
0909.1522: Ground-based solar telescopes can benefit from service-mode observations, allowing for more efficient and flexible scheduling, increased scientific output, and improved data sharing, but require significant infrastructure and cultural changes.
1112.4221: No summary available, as the provided text is acknowledgments and does not contain a technical paper.
1407.7901: A web-based applet is developed to help students explore the relationships between interparticle interactions and equilibrium structure and thermodynamic properties in fluids, using a new analytic integral equation-based method.
1209.1116: The authors simulate the evolution of the Sagittarius dwarf spheroidal galaxy with and without dark matter, concluding that an extended galaxy with a large dark matter halo is necessary to reproduce its observed properties.
1502.03296: Linguistic laws, such as Zipf's law, are often statistically valid but not strictly true due to long-range correlations and fluctuations in text data, requiring alternative interpretations and null models.
1306.5518: The study validates the Random Phase and Amplitude (RPA) formalism in weak turbulence by comparing its predictions with direct numerical simulations (DNS) of a three-wave resonant Hamiltonian system, showing good quantitative agreement in various statistical aspects of amplitude fluctuations.
1309.7775: Researchers numerically demonstrate collective quantum many-body collapse by quantum tunneling in a metastable Bose-Einstein condensate with attractive interactions, obtaining the tunneling rate and its dependence on interaction strength and atom number.
0708.1406: Researchers use angular-dependent near-edge X-ray absorption fine structure (NEXAFS) spectroscopy to determine the molecular orientation of tetrathiafulvalene-tetracyanoquinodimethane (TTF-TCNQ) molecules on its surface, finding no evidence of surface relaxation.
1210.1901: This paper investigates the tidal breakup of stellar binaries in the vicinity of a massive black hole (MBH) and its implications for the formation of hypervelocity stars (HVSs) and GC S-stars. The authors propose a working hypothesis that both HVSs and GC S-stars are the products of tidal breakup of stellar binaries.
nucl-ex0305029: Preliminary results show an increase in the @xmath1/@xmath0 ratio with energy from 0.5 at SPS to 1 at RHIC energies in both central Pb+Pb and p+p interactions.
1703.03148: The paper proves that the tensor product of a circulant graph with property and any hamilton cycle decomposable multigraph is hamilton cycle decomposable.
hep-ph0106208: The authors calculate the leading order wave functions of B→ρℓν decay and extract the CKM matrix element |Vub| using the light cone sum rule approach in the heavy quark effective theory.
1005.2652: Researchers propose a new index called "bridgeness" to quantify the significance of edges in maintaining global connectivity in document networks, outperforming content similarity and other structural indices.
astro-ph0508136: The study detects a net positive correlation signal between galaxies and quasars over the entire redshift range, consistent with magnification bias due to gravitational lensing, but with a large discrepancy between observed and modeled integrated cross-correlation functions.
1509.02821: Fat tails in income distributions and cosmic ray energy distributions arise from a universal feature of binary microscopic interactions, where high-energy particles or rich individuals tend to preserve most of their energy or wealth in interactions.
1607.07708: The authors investigate the magnetic ground state phase diagram of the Anderson-Hubbard model with spin-dependent disorder, using the dynamical mean-field theory, and find two weakly antiferromagnetic spin-selective localized phases.
1604.02414: Researchers develop a local feedback control strategy to preserve entanglement in two-qubit systems undergoing amplitude damping, achieving optimal entanglement preservation with minimal disturbance.
0812.1150: The Zeplin-III experiment reports a null result for dark matter searches, with a 90% confidence upper limit of 8.1 x 10^-45 pb for the spin-independent WIMP-nucleon elastic scattering cross-section.
gr-qc0702063: Researchers propose a novel form of quasi-confinement in five-dimensional warped product spaces, where massive particles oscillate about hypersurfaces while remaining close to them, providing a neutrally stable confinement mechanism.
astro-ph0103197: A millimeter-wave CO survey of 18 IR-excess quasars reveals 8 detections with molecular gas masses in the range 10^9-10^11 M⊙, indicating massive cold molecular components in their host galaxies.
astro-ph0208486: Eros contribute significantly to the 850 μm extragalactic background light, with the @xmath29 population accounting for 43-60% of the 850 μm ebl, primarily arising from dusty starbursts.
1310.6380: A novel GPU-accelerated implementation of the mixed-variational method for phononic band-structure calculations is presented, achieving over 100-fold performance gains over the unoptimized serial implementation.
cond-mat0307275: The presence of neighboring islands decreases the wetting of the substrate by 3D islands, with larger island densities and steeper side walls reducing wetting more strongly.
0909.2338: Researchers investigate microwave nonlinear effects in underdoped cuprate superconductors using a novel experimental technique, revealing a complex harmonic voltage with a temperature-dependent phase that exhibits a non-monotonic behavior, decreasing from 5 radians in the superconducting state, reaching a minimum close to the critical temperature, and recovering back to 5 radians.
1703.07024: A cross-correlation analysis of the tidal disruption event ASASSN-14li reveals that its X-ray variations lag optical/UV fluctuations by 32 days, ruling out reprocessing and direct emission from a standard accretion disk, and suggesting three possible models: shocks-at-apocenter, elliptical accretion disk, and series-of-discrete-interactions.
math0508533: A probabilistic analysis of a mathematical model for asynchronous parallel simulation is presented, focusing on a cascade model with a subordination between processors, where a conjecture on cluster behavior is justified using stochastic comparison and Foster-Lyapunov functions.
1410.2111: Graphene nanoislands exhibit extraordinary nonlinear optical response, with second- and third-harmonic generation exceeding those of conventional nonlinear materials by several orders of magnitude.
1508.05289: Researchers develop two high-finesse fiber Fabry-Perot cavity architectures for cavity quantum electrodynamics experiments, comparing a conventional piezo-mechanically actuated design with a novel rigid design that exhibits high passive stability and precise thermal tunability.
1004.0201: A general method for direct evaluation of the temperature dependence of the quantum rate constant is presented, increasing efficiency and accuracy by avoiding umbrella sampling and reducing systematic errors.
1503.02280: We identified and calculated the renormalization of the dimension 6 twist 4 gluon operators to one loop order in the pure gauge theory, enabling systematic study of QCD sum rule methods for the heavy quark system in medium up to dimension 6 level.
0706.1666: Numerical solutions of the BK equation do not display exact geometric scaling, but approach it asymptotically, suggesting a non-trivial dependence on initial conditions.
astro-ph9912417: High-velocity clouds are compact, isolated gas clouds with properties similar to those of low-mass galaxies, suggesting they may be unevolved sub-dwarf galaxies or remnants of galaxy formation.
0802.2399: A novel algorithm is presented for generating boundary-aligned meshes with well-shaped cells, based on the inverse Poisson problem, which is a global and explicitly formulated problem that relates mesh generation to the inverse Poisson problem.
1210.3290: The authors study the process of neutral pion photoproduction in the timelike region using a Regge pole model, providing a consistent description of the data and allowing for the extraction of timelike nucleon form factors.
1206.3858: Researchers investigate the optimal arrangement of soap bubbles to minimize perimeter, finding that for large numbers of bubbles, even hexagonal clusters may not be the best configuration.
cond-mat0606074: Researchers investigate the zero-temperature properties of the planar pyrochlore quantum magnet, finding evidence for a crossed dimer phase with a spin gap, contradicting the sliding Luttinger liquid phase.
1102.1286: Researchers measured the elliptic flow of the φ-meson in Au+Au collisions at RHIC, finding it scales with the number of constituent quarks, indicating quark coalescence in its formation.
0707.4019: Researchers measured the contribution of neutrons to the signals of the Dream calorimeter, a device that measures hadronic energy, and found that neutrons contribute up to 45% of the total signal from off-axis towers through elastic scattering off protons in plastic scintillating fibers.
1102.2720: This paper explores the application of higher order holonomy corrections to the perturbation theory of cosmology in Loop Quantum Cosmology (LQC), determining the range of the parameter μ.
cond-mat0107307: The authors report _ab initio_ free-energy calculations of high-pressure/high-temperature liquid iron, combining with earlier results on the solid to obtain the complete melting curve and the variation of the volume and entropy of melting along the curve.
nucl-th9710064: We demonstrate that charm matter can be produced at the coming RHIC collider in reasonable amounts, with about 10^10 multiple charmed exotics measurable per year, and investigate the properties of charmed matter and finite multiple charmed objects.
1108.2508: The galaxy merger rate is a fundamental measure of galaxy evolution, but its evolution with redshift remains uncertain due to varying methodologies and observational biases, and a new calculation of the average merger observability timescale is crucial for interpreting observed galaxy merger fractions.
quant-ph9702058: A quantum algorithm can be implemented fault-tolerantly with a threshold error rate, allowing for arbitrary accuracy in quantum computations despite physically reasonable sources of noise.
hep-ph9907219: This paper investigates radiative corrections to electroweak parameters in supersymmetric models with almost degenerate chargino and neutralino masses, finding bounds on the light gaugino mass.
0712.3715: The authors develop a dissipative generalization of the macroscopic hydrodynamic approach, viscous relativistic fluid dynamics, to study the effects of shear viscosity on the evolution of the energy and entropy density, flow profile, source eccentricity, and total momentum anisotropy in heavy-ion collisions.
1306.5908: A study of the young open cluster NGC 2264 reveals an excess of Algol-type eclipsing binaries, with a frequency 25 times higher than in the field, suggesting anisotropic angular momentum vectors in the cluster.
1509.04077: A new scenario of compressible plasma turbulence is proposed, where dominant anti-sunward Alfvén waves interact with sunward quasi-perpendicular slow magnetosonic waves, leading to bi-directional asymmetric proton beams and energy dissipation.
cond-mat0502200: Researchers study the deposition and evaporation of hard rods on a 2D substrate, finding a transition from an isotropic to a nematic phase with algebraically decaying correlations, and demonstrating gradient-induced ordering effects.
hep-ph9804285: The authors propose that the highest energy cosmic rays originate from the decay of massive metastable relic particles, specifically cryptons, which constitute a fraction of the dark matter in the galactic halo, with a mass of approximately 10^10 GeV and a lifetime of 10^26 seconds.
1401.1469: Researchers derive a microscopic quantum field theory that unifies local-field and cascading effects in spectroscopy, systematically accounting for vacuum-mediated interactions between particles.
hep-lat9608102: Researchers perform lattice QCD simulations to calculate light hadron masses, using various lattice volumes, quark masses, and lattice spacings to control finite size and chiral limits, and explore improved actions for more accurate results.
0807.1538: The authors investigate the information content in the weak lensing power spectrum using Sloan Digital Sky Survey data, finding a clear signal of saturation in the cumulative information at high multipoles, indicating a loss of information due to non-linear effects.
1004.0503: The paper examines two-armed nearly vertical oscillations in polytropic disks, finding trapped oscillations with frequencies dependent on mode and polytropic index, covering a wide frequency range.
0803.1371: The authors study the stability of five-dimensional Myers-Perry black holes with equal angular momenta, utilizing the spacetime symmetry to identify master variables and derive master equations, and show the stability of these black holes for certain modes.
astro-ph9806036: A study of the relationship between low-redshift Lyman-alpha absorbers and galaxies reveals that the absorbers are not randomly distributed with respect to galaxies, with some absorbers associated with luminous galaxies and others potentially being intergalactic gas clouds.
1411.5275: The paper studies identifying codes in graphs, which are subsets of vertices that dominate and separate every pair of vertices. The authors provide a general bound on the size of identifying codes in vertex-transitive graphs, and then focus on strongly regular graphs, which have a specific structure that makes them easier to analyze. They provide a bound on the size of identifying codes in strongly regular graphs and show that this bound is tight for some specific families of graphs, including generalized quadrangles. The authors also provide constructions of identifying
math9810042: This paper presents a construction of a symplectic Lefschetz fibration with a prescribed fundamental group, providing an explicit and effective method to control the number of singular fibers.
1308.1869: This paper presents a space-time discontinuous Galerkin method for solving optimal control problems governed by convection-diffusion-reaction equations. The method combines symmetric interior penalty Galerkin (SIPG) in space and discontinuous Galerkin (DG) in time, achieving optimal convergence rates and commuting optimality systems.
gr-qc9903040: Einstein gravity and Chern-Simons theory are not equivalent at the level of gauge equivalence classes of physical states due to the presence of large gauge symmetries in Einstein gravity.
quant-ph0409123: Researchers derive adiabatic solutions of Maxwell-Bloch equations for a three-level EIT system, enabling coherent control of probe light propagation direction and polarization.
1112.2182: Researchers develop a new galaxy evolution model to improve the treatment of galactic winds in cosmological simulations, describing the entire subsequent evolution of a galaxy up to the present, including the progressive injection of energy by supernovae and stellar winds.
cond-mat0207492: This paper investigates the spin polarization and interface resistance of Fe/ZnSe(001) and Fe/GaAs(001) interfaces, analyzing the effects of Schottky barrier thickness and termination.
1604.03569: Researchers observe a one-sided, extremely high-velocity jet powered by the intermediate-mass protostar Serpens SMM1, with ionized outflow cavity detected via free-free emission.
1011.4002: The authors investigate the dynamics of exponential flights and their relation with the linear Boltzmann equation, providing a framework for a generic d-dimensional setup and emphasizing the key role of d in determining the properties of the propagator and collision density.
cond-mat0504289: The paper presents a generalized Hubbard-III approximation for the asymmetric Hubbard model, which describes a system with two types of mobile particles with different hopping integrals and chemical potentials. The approach combines the description of the band structure of the Falicov-Kimball model and the standard Hubbard model, and gives nontrivial results for the spectrum of localized particles in the Falicov-Kimball model. The critical value of the interaction strength for the metal-insulator transition is obtained analytically in the
0811.1120: Researchers propose a method to calibrate photodetectors using stimulated spontaneous parametric down-conversion, enabling precise calibration in high-gain regimes and linking photon counting to traditional optical metrology.
astro-ph9802138: The secular evolution of cataclysmic variables is affected by nova outbursts, which cause discontinuous changes in mass transfer rate and orbital period, and frictional angular momentum loss (faml) amplifies the mass transfer rate, but its overall influence is small.
0902.3149: Researchers observe the radio galaxy M87 and Hydra A at 90 GHz, finding evidence of complex particle loss and resupply histories, with minimal signs of electron aging in M87 and significant depletion of high-energy electrons in Hydra A.
1005.0286: The authors study Hawking radiation from fluctuating black holes, considering the interaction between a scalar field and metric fluctuations. They derive the canonical quadratic action for metric perturbations and cubic interaction terms in the 4-dimensional Schwarzschild background. The deviation from the Planck spectrum is found to be proportional to the square of the amplitude of metric fluctuations, indicating a small but non-zero effect of the cubic interaction on Hawking radiation.
1203.6109: Researchers investigate topological superconductivity in electron- and hole-doped semiconductors with Rashba and Dresselhaus spin-orbit couplings and in-plane Zeeman fields, finding well-defined plateaus in anomalous Hall and Nernst effects in topological regimes.
1602.02513: The authors constrain the time variation of the gravitational constant G using transit timing variations of exoplanetary systems, yielding a limit of 6.7 x 10^-12/year, weaker than previous constraints but complementary in nature.
0710.2845: Researchers study rubrene single-crystal field-effect transistors with highly polarizable gate dielectrics, observing saturation of source-drain current and increasing activation energy with carrier density, explained by interacting small Fröhlich polarons.
0801.2257: A 3D numerical simulation of a magnetized, turbulent, and self-gravitating molecular cloud reveals that the core mass function (CMF) is steeper for cores identified at higher density thresholds, indicating the increasing importance of gravity in the virial balance of cores at higher densities.
0808.2169: This paper proves an inequality for the number of points of complete intersections, providing a more precise version of a result by Hooley and Katz, and generalizing Deligne's theorem for nonsingular complete intersections.
physics0703239: Researchers develop high-quality ultracold neutron (UCN) guides with reflectivity exceeding 99.9% using a revisited replication technique, enabling efficient UCN transportation for fundamental neutron property investigations.
0810.3194: The authors perform a systematic study of direct photon production in p+A and A+A collisions at RHIC, taking into account hot and cold nuclear matter effects, and find that cold nuclear matter effects dominate the direct photon production.
astro-ph0410700: A nova, V4743 Sgr, is studied using XMM-Newton and Chandra spectra, revealing an extremely hot white dwarf with strong absorption features, indicating a CNO-processed material with a low C/N abundance ratio.
astro-ph0206414: Air shower simulations have improved significantly in the last decade, with better understanding of hadronic interactions and increased computer performance, enabling detailed Monte Carlo models that track individual particles and simulate interactions with matter.
astro-ph0701780: The mass within the luminous radius of dwarf galaxies is well constrained by their stellar velocity dispersion, and is approximately independent of their luminosity, implying that dark matter halos have peak circular velocities a factor of 3 times larger than their stellar velocity dispersion.
1110.1750: The authors calculate the two-loop electroweak radiative corrections to the parity-violating asymmetry in Moller scattering, focusing on the quadratic part, and find it to be significant, potentially increasing the asymmetry by up to 42% at future colliders.
1203.2156: A Monte Carlo analysis of 12 years of radial velocity data on 114 massive stars in the Cyg OB2 association reveals a binary fraction of 44% among massive stars, with a hard lower limit of 21%, and a possible upper limit of 68% if periods as long as 10 years are allowed.
nucl-th9908071: The authors derive analytic expressions for the Coulomb interaction between a spherical projectile and a deformed target, valid for any separation distance, and demonstrate significant deviations from commonly used models.
0905.3412: Researchers demonstrate a novel effect of light forces causing self-alignment or instability in a waveguide broken by an offset and a gap, depending on waveguide size and mode polarization.
1111.5225: The authors study the finite-temperature Lipkin-Meshkov-Glick (LMG) model using the mutual information, a measure of both classical and quantum many-body correlations, to detect phase transitions.
1605.00113: A digital base-band design for a duty-cycled wake-up receiver in 65nm CMOS is presented, achieving negligible power consumption and improving practical sensitivity of the target analog front-end.
0905.4300: The emission from NGC 7538 IRS1 is dominated by a collimated ionized jet, explaining its variable free-free emission and broad recombination lines.
astro-ph0308335: Eight sources of periodic x-ray variability were detected in the galactic center, with seven likely being magnetically accreting white dwarfs or wind-accreting neutron stars, and one being an eclipsing polar in the foreground.
cond-mat0506064: This paper analytically calculates the dynamical evolution of quantum squeezing and entanglement in a two-mode Bose-Einstein condensate with an adiabatically varying, off-resonant atom-light coupling.
1109.4521: Researchers propose a method to determine centrality in complex networks without fixing all link weights, using a subset of links and assigning positive weights to ensure eigenvector centrality.
1602.02979: Researchers investigate the ground state phase diagrams of ferromagnetic and antiferromagnetic long-range transverse field Ising models on the triangular lattice, determining the critical transverse field strength at which the transition from the fully x-polarized phase to the clock-ordered phase occurs.
1702.07599: The authors analyze the rare semi-leptonic hadron decays induced by flavor changing neutral currents to test the Standard Model and beyond, focusing on the interplay of SM-induced backgrounds for a K-meson beyond the narrow-width approximation.
1109.5333: The authors investigate the generalized Lieb-Robinson velocity in an Ising spin chain with a strong transverse field, demonstrating its existence and sudden switch in different types of correlations.
nlin0201002: The paper challenges the Kraichnan-Leith-Batchelor (KLB) theory of 2D Navier-Stokes turbulence, showing that a direct enstrophy cascade is not permitted and the energy spectrum cannot scale as predicted by the KLB theory.
1609.09796: The paper generalizes the classical Travelling Salesman Problem (TSP) to the 0-stripe TSP, which is NP-hard in multi-partite graphs, split graphs, and graphs without induced sub-graph K_4, but solvable in polynomial time in planar graphs and partial k-trees.
1201.4783: The authors improve the Derjaguin approximation for electrostatic forces between conducting surfaces by expanding the energy in derivatives of the surface shapes, allowing for the computation of next-to-leading order corrections.
hep-th0407178: This paper explores the string theory and field theory aspects of parallel d-brane splitting in type IIA orientifolds, providing a tool for constructing intersecting d6-brane models with potentially realistic particle physics.
0709.4091: Researchers analyze barred galaxies' central regions using emission and absorption spectral indices, estimating oxygen abundances, stellar ages, and metallicities, revealing complex star formation histories and galaxy evolution.
cond-mat9207010: This paper develops a numerical technique for calculating unstable periodic orbits in the stadium billiard, providing a complete classification of all periodic orbits and allowing for the calculation of any particular orbit to high accuracy.
1312.0161: The author discusses the unsustainable growth of human societies, citing the contradiction between the need for economic growth and the physical limits of the environment, which are ignored by ideology and economic science.
astro-ph0208106: The galaxy's formation is a complex process, with the dark halo assembling first, followed by the formation of the stellar bulge, globular clusters, and the disk. The galaxy's evolution is marked by violent gas dynamics and accretion events, leading to the formation of the thick disk, which is a relic of the early disk. The galaxy's components, including the halo, disk, and bulge, preserve signatures of their formation, with the thin disk and thick disk retaining the most information
1003.1788: Researchers propose a hybrid atom-molecule quantum device for optical storage, processing, and retrieval by transferring quantum states from associating light to atom-heteronuclear molecule dark states.
1501.05159: This paper presents the results of a spectroscopic study of 12 low-luminosity, low-surface brightness dwarf galaxies selected from the ALFALFA catalog, aiming to determine their chemical abundances and explore the luminosity-metallicity and mass-metallicity relationships in the local universe.
hep-lat0306020: This paper discusses the formulation of lattice theories with nonlinearly realized chiral symmetry, which allows for the removal of fermion doublers without breaking chiral symmetry explicitly.
1601.01964: Researchers discover a new instability in rotating conducting fluids under magnetic fields, the azimuthal magnetorotational instability (AMRI), which destabilizes Taylor-Couette flows with positive shear.
quant-ph9611036: This paper presents an operational theory of the eight-port homodyne detection scheme, deriving operational quadrature operators for an arbitrary noise field and constructing quantum trigonometry and wigner functions for the squeezed vacuum noise field.
math0511299: This paper presents a new algorithm for regression estimation in the transductive setting, where the goal is to estimate the regression function on a test sample given a training sample. The algorithm is based on a PAC-Bayes inequality and uses a greedy approach to select the most informative features. The authors provide a detailed analysis of the algorithm's performance, including a bound on the risk of the estimator and a rate of convergence in Sobolev and Besov spaces. The results are compared to the inductive setting
astro-ph0102322: Detection of large dust grains in circumbinary disks around evolved binary stars, suggesting the presence of long-lived disks with masses of at least 5 x 10^6 g.
1308.1714: This study investigates the effectiveness of a coupled model combining interactive computer simulations and real-time formative assessment in enhancing learning gains for engineering physics students, finding significant gains across all learning styles.
1608.02377: This paper investigates regional controllability of Riemann-Liouville time fractional diffusion equations, characterizing strategic actuators and providing an approach to regional controllability with minimum energy.
nucl-th0410004: The paper discusses finite temperature and light-front quantization, developing a formal framework for covariant calculations at finite temperatures in the light-front form, and applying many-body Green functions to treat hot and dense quantum systems.
1302.3180: A precise age of 14.46 Gyr is determined for the oldest known star, HD 140283, using its parallax and oxygen abundance, with an uncertainty of 0.8 Gyr.
1510.07569: Researchers develop a macroscopic model to describe 2D metallic conductivity at the LaAlO3/SrTiO3 interface, revealing a criterion for interface metallicity based on material parameters and Fermi level.
1209.2193: This report explores the importance of medium modifications of nucleon-nucleon cross sections on direct reactions, particularly knockout reactions, showing noticeable effects at low energies and larger corrections for weakly bound nuclei.
1509.06861: The spectral function of the Tomonaga-Luttinger model shows non-universal behavior and does not exhibit power-law scaling for generic two-particle potentials, contradicting the results of ad hoc regularization procedures.
1007.4607: Researchers investigate the quantum dynamics of solitons in cold-atom systems, focusing on the center-of-mass motion and shape deformation in disordered potentials, and derive a linear-response kernel for the soliton shape deformation.
1606.08885: The paper investigates the granular fluidity in inhomogeneous flows, proposing a kinetic pressure formula and testing its validity through DEM simulations, finding that fluidity is influenced by both velocity fluctuations and packing fraction.
astro-ph9906373: Evidence for high-energy gamma-ray pulsations from the young, energetic radio pulsar PSR B1046-58, establishing a counterpart for the unidentified high-energy gamma-ray source 2EG J1049-1587.
astro-ph0309633: The authors propose a moderate cooling flow model where hot intracluster gas cools via heat conduction to cold clouds, reducing x-ray emission and reconciling observations with the standard cooling flow model.
0805.4603: The quiescent black hole X-ray binary V404 Cyg is detected with the High Sensitivity Array, showing non-thermal synchrotron radiation and a brightness temperature of 10^9 K, with a constrained jet length of 0.3 mas.
hep-ex0201012: The inclusive production of the J/ψ and ψ(2S) mesons in hadronic Z decays is studied, with results compared to model predictions, and the muonic branching ratio of the ψ(2S) is measured for the first time.
1608.00121: This study explores the accretion history of galaxies through the accreted stellar halo, finding significant stochasticity and variability in its assembly, with dynamical friction playing a major role in shaping stellar deposition.
1611.05692: A holographic origin of dark energy is proposed, where the mass-energy of a test particle represents the gravitational binding energy, and a sharp transition to an inverse distance law of gravity is observed in galaxy rotation curves, consistent with Milgrom's law.
1406.3712: This paper derives the expansion law of the universe from the first law of thermodynamics, and applies this approach to various modified gravities, including Horava-Lifshitz gravity, f(R) gravity, and scalar-tensor gravity, obtaining the corresponding dynamic equations and Friedmann equations.
1508.07279: This paper investigates unitals in shift planes of order q^2, where q is an odd prime power. It provides a generic construction of unitals in shift planes of order q^2 and investigates various geometric and combinatorial properties of these unitals. The paper also considers the inequivalence between the unitals constructed in this paper and the unitals derived from unitary polarities in shift planes.
1409.7413: Researchers introduce a nearly one-dimensional system featuring two-dimensional PT symmetry, realized as a ladder-type lattice with staggered gain and loss elements and onsite cubic nonlinearity, and construct discrete stationary solitons seeded by a single excited rung or a pair of adjacent ones, identifying their stability via eigenfrequency calculations.
1310.2405: A multi-channel scheme for continuous-variable quantum key distribution (CV-QKD) is proposed, utilizing subcarrier multiplexing in microwave photonics. The scheme generates multiple independent secret keys in parallel, increasing the total secret key rate and potentially constructing a CV-QKD network.
astro-ph0603040: Astrometric follow-up observations of isolated planetary lensing events can firmly distinguish between wide-separation and free-floating planets by measuring the centroid shift induced by the primary star.
astro-ph0505352: The SMC X-ray binary pulsar SXP504 exhibits optical outbursts at 268-day intervals, with Lomb-Scargle analysis confirming a 268-day orbital period and a 10-day pulse period, consistent with the Corbet diagram.
astro-ph0603270: A hybrid model combining a non-radiative hydrodynamical simulation and a semi-analytic model of galaxy formation is used to study the intracluster medium (ICM) chemical enrichment in galaxy clusters.
astro-ph0402645: A stochastic, multiple acceleration model for solar flare particle acceleration is proposed, assuming an ensemble of unstable current sheets (UCS) distributed in space, forming a fractal set. The model simulates the evolution of charged particles inside an evolving network of UCS, with particles undergoing acceleration and free flights. The model yields kinetic energy distributions with a maxwellian at low energies and a power-law tail above roughly 100 keV, consistent with observations. The model also predicts heating of the plasma, which can
0711.3555: The paper investigates the collisional interaction between dark matter particles and baryons in galaxy clusters, proposing a new heating mechanism to explain the observed cooling flows.
astro-ph9911229: The mass function of young star clusters in the Antennae galaxies is a power-law, similar to that of diffuse and molecular clouds, but distinct from the lognormal mass function of old globular clusters.
0705.1753: Researchers measured the low-lying dipole strength in neutron-rich 12C using Coulomb excitation, observing a significant amount of strength centered around 8 MeV, consistent with theoretical predictions of a pygmy resonance.
1311.4976: This paper establishes the asymptotic equivalence of quantum state tomography and trace regression under certain conditions, allowing for the application of matrix completion methods to quantum state tomography.
hep-lat0603016: Researchers studied the wave functions and sizes of scalar and tensor glueballs using an improved 3D U(1) lattice model, finding the tensor glueball is roughly twice as large as the scalar glueball.
1510.08919: The paper studies the effect of weak noise on the escape from a resonance zone in a prototypical beam type nonlinear energy harvesting model, using homogenization and large deviations to derive a large deviation principle for the rate of escape.
1008.0739: Researchers propose a new pathway to spin decoherence in high g-factor semiconductors, attributing increased spin decoherence to electron-electron magnetic interaction, which may limit the suitability of InSb for spin transport devices.
0804.3425: A self-gravity induced groove mode in a disk can drive a fast-growing instability, potentially modifying the criterion for gap opening and affecting the migration and growth of protoplanets, even at lower disk masses.
1412.0688: A unified theory of dissipation in ferromagnetic systems with arbitrary spin current alignment is developed, enabling simultaneous evaluation of bulk and interface heating.
1012.3726: The metric space obtained from the scaling limit of a uniformly random bipartite quadrangulation of genus g with n faces is almost surely homeomorphic to the g-torus.
astro-ph0009456: High-resolution observations of the massive protostellar object S140 IRS1 reveal a complex circumstellar environment with a partially evacuated cavity carved out by a strong molecular outflow.
math0608493: The paper proves a sharp estimate for the local behavior of the integral means spectrum of a univalent function near the point 2, extending the Jones-Makarov result to complex values.
1009.3183: We study the robustness of coupled networks with coinciding degrees of mutually dependent nodes and derive new recursive equations describing the cascade of failures. We show that these networks disintegrate via a first-order transition and are more robust than their randomly coupled counterparts with the same degree distribution.
1112.0218: The paper discusses the phenomenology of composite Higgs models and the LHC potential to discover new states, focusing on the bounds on the composite Higgs model spectrum from flavor observables and the LHC discovery reach on heavy gluons and fermions.
1108.4838: The Tracer instrument measures the energy spectra of highly relativistic cosmic-ray nuclei, providing a comprehensive set of measurements of individual energy spectra of major primary cosmic-ray nuclei from oxygen to iron, covering the energy range from 11 GeV/amu to several TeV/amu.
quant-ph0403166: Researchers derive an explicit expression for the magnetic spin flip rate of an atom near an absorbing dielectric body, with implications for atom chip design and quantum information processing.
1006.3577: A nearby T6 brown dwarf, DENIS J081730.0-615520, is discovered with a distance of 3 parsecs, providing insights into the local brown dwarf population and the need for more sensitive surveys to complete the census.
hep-th0006026: The authors investigate the phenomenon of soliton mixing in supersymmetric theories, where two degenerate mass solitons can mix nonperturbatively, lifting the Bogomolnyi-Prasad-Sommerfield (BPS) bound. They calculate the shift in the soliton masses from the BPS bound in the quasi-classical approximation, which is proportional to the tunneling probability determined by instantons.
1511.01148: The paper proves a lower bound for the moments of quadratic Dirichlet L-functions associated to a family of hyperelliptic curves over a finite field, generalizing a result of Rudnick and Soundararajan.
1311.7554: The authors investigate the possibility of measuring CP asymmetry in rare pion decays in scenarios with two heavy sterile neutrinos, which could be detectable in future pion factories, and determine the feasibility of distinguishing between Dirac and Majorana neutrinos based on the observed CP asymmetry.
astro-ph0607308: This paper presents radial velocity observations of 14 southern contact binary stars and two suspected variable stars, providing preliminary orbital solutions for all observed binaries.
1207.2091: The authors investigate the stability and spontaneous symmetry breaking of discrete solitary modes in one-dimensional lattices with quadratic nonlinearity, demonstrating that the symmetry-breaking bifurcation changes from super- to subcritical with the change of mismatch.
1109.5571: Researchers discover new cross-phase modulated localized soliton solutions for an atom-molecule Bose-Einstein condensate, exhibiting distinct collective oscillations and novel instability mechanisms.
1404.0768: Researchers develop a linear-response formalism of the dc spin pumping into a fluctuating ferromagnet near the Curie temperature, showing that the spin pumping can be largely enhanced due to the fluctuation enhancement of the interface spin conductance.
1303.6188: The paper resolves the "4/3 problem" in classical electrodynamics by showing that discrepancies in back-reaction calculations arise from compensating discrepancies within the materials holding the charges.
1602.07000: This work presents an indirect search for secluded dark matter (SDM) using 2007-2012 data from the Antares neutrino telescope, constraining SDM models with mediator decay into dimuons, neutrinos from dimuons, or directly into neutrinos.
comp-gas9404001: A new method is proposed to deal with cancellations in quantum systems, using a phase method to reduce the number of runs required to obtain accurate statistics, improving the efficiency of simulations for fermions and bosons.
astro-ph0212369: The author investigates the implications of exotic equations of state for dark energy on the age of the universe, finding that a sharply increasing age with negative equation of state parameter tails off above 18 gyr, and that direct age determinations have a residual uncertainty, while cosmological estimates using supernovae and CMB data offer the best possibility for constraining large negative values of the equation of state parameter.
cond-mat0301530: Monte Carlo simulations of a 3D XY model for YBCO show that classical phase fluctuations cannot explain the observed non-linear temperature dependence of the magnetic field penetration depth along the c-axis.
1211.3861: The authors acknowledge support from the Mosaico project and express gratitude for discussions with V.A. Malyshev and the University of Groningen's hospitality.
astro-ph0003031: The HH7-11 outflow is a complex region with both continuous and jump shock components, where the gas-phase water is deficient, likely due to freezing onto warm grains processed through the jump shock front.
cond-mat0612104: Researchers model the nonlinear behavior of spin-1 Bose-Einstein condensates in a one-dimensional optical lattice, discovering multi-component, spatially localized states within band gaps, including vector gap solitons and self-trapped waves.
astro-ph0411296: Researchers model the mid-infrared emission of post-AGB star IRAS 19500-1709, finding small dust grains and a steep size distribution provide the best fit to the data.
0710.4131: This paper studies the stability of excited state oscillatons, which are soliton stars described by a real scalar field, and their gravitational wave emission in 3D numerical relativity.
1508.02250: A unified framework for evaluating continuum field expressions from molecular simulations is presented, generalizing the Irving-Kirkwood procedure to arbitrary multi-body potentials. The framework involves two steps: obtaining pointwise continuum fields using a generalized Irving-Kirkwood procedure and spatial averaging to obtain macroscopic quantities. The new definitions for specific internal energy and heat flux vector are derived, which are invariant with respect to changes in the potential energy and do not contain a transport part. Numerical experiments show that the new definitions agree with the
1006.5705: This paper derives the Faddeev equations for the three-to-three scattering amplitude in the n+n+^4He system, providing a reliable path to the three-to-three scattering S-matrix, which contains the information of the resonance structure of the ^3He system.
0812.3995: Researchers study quasi-periodic oscillations in accretion discs, proposing a model for interface modes at the magnetosphere-disc boundary, which may explain high-frequency QPOs in neutron star and black hole X-ray binaries.
1005.4613: The authors investigate the effect of expanding spherical impulsive gravitational waves on geodesic motion in constant-curvature backgrounds, including Minkowski, de Sitter, and anti-de Sitter spaces. They derive explicit junction conditions and refraction formulae for geodesics crossing the impulse, and apply these results to a particular family of spacetimes generated by a snapped cosmic string.
1408.4407: The pn-qrpa model is used to calculate the stellar electron and positron decay rates of iron isotopes, revealing that the calculated rates are smaller than previously assumed and are irrelevant for the determination of the evolution of 1 during the presupernova phase of massive stars.
1409.2491: A comprehensive catalog of gamma-ray bursts (GRBs) with isolated emission episodes is presented, revealing that a significant percentage of GRBs show pre-peak and post-peak activity, with no correlation between these episodes and the main event properties.
1611.05853: A cosmological first-order phase transition may have several observable consequences, including the generation of baryon asymmetry, formation of topological defects, and production of gravitational waves. The authors investigate the dynamics of a very strong phase transition, where the nucleation rate is dominated by the exponential approximation, which breaks down in this regime. They propose a gaussian approximation for the nucleation rate and analyze its ranges of validity. The authors compare the analytic results with numerical computations and discuss the effect of using different approx
gr-qc0110020: The 1200m experiment in GEO600 demonstrates a frequency stabilisation system for gravitational wave detection, achieving the required frequency noise reduction by stabilising the laser to suspended cavities.
1412.6859: This study investigates the spatial entropies of shift spaces according to their approximating ways to a two-dimensional lattice and compares them with commonly used rectangular spatial entropies.
1006.5426: The Atlas Forward Physics (AFP) project aims to study central exclusive production (CEP) processes, including Higgs boson production, using spectrometers at 220m and 420m from the interaction point, with a mass acceptance spanning 80 GeV to over 1 TeV.
1408.0825: Researchers experimentally demonstrate single-photon superradiance in a cesium atomic ensemble, observing enhanced decay rates and directional emission.
cond-mat0602370: This paper demonstrates that kinetic growth walks (KGWs) are not equivalent to interacting self-avoiding walks (ISAWs) at any bath temperature, contradicting previous claims, and provides Monte Carlo evidence for this equivalence on square and triangular lattices.
0807.0707: Researchers study the effect of a periodic magnetic field on a 2D electron gas, finding that it leads to electron localization and the formation of persistent currents in a ring array, and that the quantum Hall effect can be observed when the Fermi energy is located in the gap.
1410.4622: This paper proposes a topological mapping framework for unknown environments using bio-inspired mobile sensor networks with limited sensing information, leveraging computational topology and machine learning to extract topological features from encounter data.
hep-th0701250: This paper develops the representation theory of the extended symmetry algebra of minimal conformal field theories, specifically the algebra generated by the modes of a simple current. The extended algebra is a graded associative algebra with a specific adjoint, and its representation theory is studied in detail. The authors derive the generalised commutation relations of the algebra, and show that the monodromy charge of a state is left invariant by the application of a Virasoro mode, but is changed by the application of a mode
0705.0792: Researchers investigate the phase structure of two-color and two-flavor QCD, finding a nonzero interval of isospin chemical potential where the Larkin-Ovchinnikov-Fulde-Ferrell (LOFF) phase is energetically more favorable than the isotropic superfluid phase and normal quark matter.
0908.3727: This paper reviews testable predictions of high-scale SUSY models, focusing on the possibility of a relatively light gluino and electroweak gauginos with dark matter that is naturally Majorana.
astro-ph0208204: The authors present deep Chandra observations of three FRII radio galaxies, 3C263, 3C330, and 3C351, to investigate the X-ray emission from their hotspots and lobes, and the implications for the magnetic field strengths and particle acceleration processes.
astro-ph0209267: Molecular gas in NGC 5728 is asymmetrically distributed, following the ionization cone and primary bar, with significant star formation at the bar tips.
astro-ph0008267: Researchers measured absorption spectra of a source during an extreme scattering event, finding no significant changes in the absorption feature, and constraining the column density of any neutral structure associated with the event lens to be below 10^18 cm^-2.
1211.2753: A novel model explains spatial genetic structure in Fucus radicans, a species with both sexual and asexual reproduction, without invoking adaptations to geographically separated environments.
1208.4599: A multi-epoch survey of RR Lyrae stars at low galactic latitude to study the structure of the galactic thick disk, with a catalogue of 211 stars and typical distance errors of 16%.
1211.3933: This paper studies the application of Rosenbrock methods to discontinuous differential systems, focusing on one-sided methods and event location, and proposes a continuous extension of Rosenbrock methods for dense output.
0809.0422: The authors argue against the applicability of intrinsic decaying states (IDs) to describe low-energy πN dynamics, instead advocating for Gamow states as the correct theoretical construct for quasibound states.
0911.0936: A Spitzer IRAC survey of 14 low-mass white dwarfs did not detect any substellar or planetary mass companions, but one target shows a nearby source likely to be a background object, and another possibly has a low-mass stellar companion.
0909.1664: Researchers analyze the Italian high-voltage electrical transmission network's vulnerability using topological analysis and a DC power flow model, identifying critical lines that are not necessarily those with highest structural relevance.
gr-qc9904022: The authors compute the two-point function and renormalized expectation value of the stress tensor in a so(3,1) invariant quantum state for two simple models of one-bubble spacetimes, finding singularities on the bubble wall and lightcone.
1306.1859: Researchers investigate quantum Hall states in honeycomb systems with high spin-Chern numbers, presenting two examples: silicene with ferromagnetic order and transition-metal oxides in electric fields.
1006.1609: Researchers investigate the Coulomb Blockade Thermometer (CBT) and Single Junction Thermometer (SJT) as primary thermometers for temperature measurements below 1K, comparing them with the Provisional Low Temperature Scale of 2000 (PLTS-2000).
1302.3664: Researchers discover a novel magnetic phase in chromium spinel oxides prior to full saturation, characterized by a highly symmetric magnetic structure and crystal structure, which cannot be explained by existing bilinear-biquadratic models.
1108.3054: The authors propose a new family of moduli, called Generalised Repunit Primes (GRPs), for efficient arithmetic in prime fields, which are particularly suitable for hardware implementation and offer side-channel security.
1305.4213: This paper investigates the potential neutrino signals from ultracompact minihalos (UCMHs) due to dark matter annihilation, providing a complementary approach to gamma-ray detection.
physics9811027: Researchers develop a model to calculate the dielectric permittivity of living cells in weak electric fields, considering the influence of membrane potential, free charge mobility, and particle geometry.
physics0702078: A detailed study of the efficiency of the Liquid Xenon Gamma-Ray Imaging Telescope (LXEGrit) for detecting gamma-rays is presented, focusing on experimental data and Monte Carlo simulations. The LXEGrit's trigger efficiency is measured and resolved versus energy and position, with an overall efficiency of 0.6% at 0.898 MeV and 1.9% at 1.836 MeV.
1510.02975: A novel method for fast and practical evaluation of continuous mathematical functions is proposed, using piecewise linear approximations and exploiting GPU hardware, achieving real-time performance and outperforming previous approaches.
0911.5408: Researchers develop a method to estimate the spin of stellar-mass black holes by fitting their X-ray continuum spectra, providing crucial information for understanding relativistic jets and gamma-ray bursts.
1206.3041: Researchers observed a peculiar low-field microwave absorption peak in LaSrMnO films with easy-plane anisotropy, which appears only in oblique magnetic fields and disappears in parallel and perpendicular orientations.
astro-ph0008062: A general spherical orbit modeling method is developed to study the dynamics of the giant elliptical galaxy M87, using all available dynamical constraints from stellar and globular cluster data.
math0406375: A classical theorem on Hausdorff dimension and projections is settled, showing an integral condition is both necessary and sufficient for a gauge function to have positive length projections.
0906.1786: We measured the thermal emission and reflected sunlight of 44 small Jupiter trojans, finding a mean r-band geometric albedo of 0.19 and median of 0.16, significantly higher than the large trojans. The albedo decreases with increasing diameter, and the size distribution is flattened relative to the constant albedo case, indicating about a factor of 2 fewer objects of radius greater than 1 km.
1606.06896: Researchers propose a novel scheme to achieve self-similar propagation of parabolic pulses in highly nonlinear passive fibers at mid-infrared wavelengths, enabling applications in spectroscopy and biomedical surgeries.
1412.1967: A new chemical evolution model is developed to reproduce the observed star formation histories and metallicity distribution functions of dwarf spheroidal galaxies, which are found to be consistent with the observed data.
